boardgame.name: The Icon
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The path of the icon barbarian is a "minor magecraft" class, which interacts with the magecraft features of the Magus class. These classes are designed to be setting-appropriate to the material the Magus is used for, while allowing players to utilize other classes and not be tied down to a full spellcaster. More will be made available!

The path of the icon is one walked by warriors who stand before their allies, protecting them with their rage instead of flailing blindly. Guiding them against great threats in battle, they do not stand down to fear and inspire their allies to do the same.

boardgame.name: Prana Duelist
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The prana duelist fighter is a "minor magecraft" class, which interacts with the magecraft features of the Magus class. These classes are designed to be setting-appropriate to the material the Magus is used for, while allowing players to utilize other classes and not be tied down to a full spellcaster. More will be made available!

The prana duelist is a direct fighter who has dipped their toes into the mystic arts. Though they prefer a straight-forward and simple method of combat, and certainly lack the arcane talent of true mages, they innately wield magical abilities that they weave into their physical talents. They are most definitely Magus, but true-blooded magi might dismissively disagree with that notion.

The truest talents of the prana duelist lay in redirecting the current of magical energy in their body as it is generated. By doing so, they can grant themselves heightened senses and physical traits for short periods of time. This magic is a form of rapid reinforcement based in the less-than-sophisticated act of propelling or shielding the body with raw prana.

boardgame.name: A Plea From the Dark (Cogent Roleplay)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Nightmares and images of the past beset the town of Stonereach. Some think it has to do with Zekash, the wizard who lured away many of the townsfolk so many years ago. You can't satisfy everyone and many have stake in what you choose.

A Plea From the Dark is an open-ended one shot horror adventure for 1st or 2nd level characters written for Cogent Roleplay.

2 to 5 hours of gameplay.
A New Monster stat block.
A New Non-magical item.
Alternate endings and suggested story paths to call back to the adventure in later in your campaign!

boardgame.name: Hawkwood Hideout (Cogent Roleplay)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Crime runs rampant through the streets. The guards, already strained beyond their limits, can do nothing about the now daily robberies. In desperation, they turn to wanderers. In exchange for their service and silence, the guards offer a reward to break the most dangerous group of criminals.

The Hawkwood Hideout is a short adventure that can serve as a one-shot session, introduction to Cogent Roleplay, or a supplemental quest to an ongoing campaign.

boardgame.name: Hawkwood Hideout (PF2)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Crime runs rampant through the streets. The guards, already strained beyond their limits, can do nothing about the now daily robberies. In desperation, they turn to wanderers. In exchange for their service and silence, the guards offer a reward to break the most dangerous group of criminals.

The Hawkwood Hideout is a short adventure that can serve as a one-shot session, introduction to Pathfinder, or a supplemental quest to an ongoing campaign.

boardgame.name: Esquire in Need
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A barrister (lawyer) needs help with an investigation in the city of Arcpool. They are known to pay well and this could help your budding hero careers!

Although set in the Xobraesal Campaign for six players of third level.

boardgame.name: Unsere Reichswehr im Manöver: Rot gegen Blau
Unsere Wehrmacht im Manöver: Rot Gegen Blau
boardgame.description:
Unsere Wehrmacht im Manover Rot Gegen Blau ("Our Army in Maneuver, Red vs. Blue") is a tiddlywinks type board game about the First World War.
On the box cover (artist Hans Friedmann, Munchen) - army cavalry men and horses are galloping from right rear to left front, while infantry marches at upper left below trees.
The trifold game board depicts a military scene with blue forces on the left fighting gray forces on the right. A footbridge is shown at center near the top. At center is a sturdy bridge with a tank on its way to cross it. Below that, troops are crossing the river in a raft. Near bottom, troops are building a wooden bridge across the river.

It is a competitive game involving to teams (players) in red and blue color. Player are fighting on the game board with different type of measures: horses, tanks, aircrafts, cannons etc. Players, who lose all measures lose the game.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Night Parade of a Hundred Yokai: Moonlight Whispers
boardgame.description:
Expansion for Night Parade of a Hundred Yokai
- 2 New Asymmetric Clans : Tanuki & Kappa
- New Abilities : Change and Hide
- The Whisper Islands

There are legends, even among the Yokai, of beings so unique and powerful that even the Yokai King himself could neither control nor banish them. The Daiyokai, whose names should never be uttered aloud, are enigmatic creatures. But beware, for they have their own agendas and are loyal to no one.

The Whisper Island Tiles represent the mysterious archipelago where the Daiyokai dwell. Each of
these Island Tiles is governed by two elements; however, you must still abide by the rule that forbids
you from placing more than 1 Meeple on each Island Tile during a single turn.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Night Parade of a Hundred Yokai

boardgame.name: Night Parade of a Hundred Yokai: Kami Rising
boardgame.description:
Expansion for Night Parade of a Hundred Yokai
- 2 New Asymmetric Clans : Kotengu, Inugami
- 2 New Yokai Abilities : Banish & Invoke

The Kami Rising expansion includes:
- 20 Painted Meeples
- 10 Torii Meeples
- 48 Yokai cards
- 4 Hidden Plots
- 9 Kami Cards
- 16 tokens (8 Invoke, 8 Banish).

If adding the cutest Dogs & Birds meeples, new mechanics and more Yokai into your game sounds like fun... Maybe you should add the Kami Rising expansion.
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Night Parade of a Hundred Yokai

boardgame.name: Manila 2076
boardgame.description:
"Sneak, hack, attack"
Manila 2076 is a “push-your-luck” competitive card game for 2 to 4 players. Each play session can last from 15 to 20 minutes.

The game is simple. You are on a mission to steal data from the megacorp. Play the highest cards, get the most data. Easy. Well, corps don't like it when you steal their stuff. The more data you have, the riskier it is for you. So be careful and manage your aggression. Don't be like the last guy who got blasted by security.

boardgame.name: The Tea Game
boardgame.description:
"Who wants a cup of tea?" one of your friends calls out at a gaming event. This is the starting point of the game, now you need to find out who will be getting up to make it.

Next question "Who's in for the tea game?" once the player count is confirmed take two D6, pass them to the starting player (the one who asked for tea) who then rolls the dice.

To stay in the game the starting player has to roll less than '12' on two D6, if successful the dice are passed clockwise to the next player who is then required to roll less than '11' on two D6. The play rotates round the group of players with the number to roll under dropping by '1' each time until someone rolls that number or greater on the dice.

That player is declared the winner of the tea game, given a rousing cheer and sent off to make the tea for all of the other players. Huzzah!

boardgame.name: The Witch's Hollow
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Can you solve the puzzle of the Witch's Hollow?

Perhaps you wish to plumb the dpeths of her lair and slay the evil demon...

Now you can do both!

Includes fantasy crossword puzzle, RPG map and descriptions, Witch stats, and a blank map for your customized adventures

boardgame.name: Den of the Surreptitious Succubus
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Fancy a crossword?

How about a dungeon?

Why not both?

Plunge into the depths of madness and escape

The Den of the Surreptitious Succubus!

boardgame.name: Phantom Epoch
boardgame.description:
Phantom Epoch is a fully cooperative 1–4 player tactical combat roleplaying board game with a persistent, choice-driven campaign that blends sci-fi and fantasy themes.

The official Kickstarter campaign for the game is set to launch in mid 2022. Follow the crowdfunding campaign at https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/doteira/phantom-epoch?r...

In a galaxy where the secrets of interstellar travel have been lost to time and primitive peoples war over ancient technology, players are thrust into missions to stop an encroaching threat. As they play through missions on numerous planets with a variety of biomes, they will discover the true nature of their enemy, and will have the opportunity to unearth the rich story of the world of Phantom Epoch.

A wide range of character choices, including human and alien species which can be combined with a diverse set of classes, allows players to create and grow their own characters to match their own play style. Each mission has its own map, objectives, enemies, and challenges. Every map has a completely unique layout. No two missions will be the same, and players will have to adjust their strategies accordingly.

Outside of missions, players will need to gather resources to repair and restore functionality to the starship that serves as their headquarters. Doing so will unlock facilities to improve their characters with upgraded equipment, attributes, and skills. As secrets from the past are revealed, they will gain combat knowledge in the form of branching advanced classes that allow players to further customize and empower their characters.

Before missions, players prepare their equipment and Action cards that they'll bring with them on a mission. During a mission, players and adversaries simultaneously select Action cards at the start of each round. The selected cards determine the turn order for the round. During their turns the players and adversaries play the selected action cards one at a time. The campaign is made up of 30+ missions, and ends when the final story mission is played. As a fully cooperative game, players win a mission together by completing the mission objective, or lose together when all players are defeated or the objective is failed.

boardgame.name: The Bell of Treason: 1938 Munich Crisis in Czechoslovakia
boardgame.description:
The Bell of Treason is a fast-paced, card-driven board game in which two players experience the existential crisis faced by Czechoslovakia in response to Hitler’s territorial demands. One player represents the ideal of trying to Defend the country, even without allies and at any cost. The other player represents the historically victorious ideal of agreeing to Concede the Sudetenland territory, in order to prevent bloodshed and hoping that Hitler’s demands would stop there. The game adapts the crisis modeling system originally introduced in Mark Herman's Fort Sumter and then further developed in Fred Serval's Red Flag Over Paris. The game does not make any judgment about whether it would have been the right choice for Czechoslovakia to defend itself in 1938, nor whether such a defense could, in any sense, have been successful. Instead, it allows you to experience for yourself this crisis period of 1938, which forever influenced Czechoslovakia's path and the eventual course of World War II. The game can also be played solo, using an adaption of the innovative and elegant system originally designed by Jason Carr for Red Flag Over Paris.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: World War 2 Operation Husky
boardgame.description:
World War 2 Operation Husky
Sicily Italy 1943

The invasion os Sicily in 1943 was called Operation Husky. The Allies composed of the USA, Canada and Great-Britain, were facing the Axis forces.

•The game is turn based ans each turn is done in 5 phases.
•Sabotage, Repair, Reinforcement, Movement, and Combat.
•In this game, you will find over 24 different scenarios, Paratroopers, Tanks, Infantries, Anti-Aircraft, Artillery Support, Air Support.
•Clear zone, Light forest, Dense forest and Hills compose the map.
•No calculation required for your movements.
•Combats are done in 3 rounds, clearing the Combat Zone more efficiently.
•Hit Allocation Table give the players control over what unit will be hit first during Combat.
•Play one on one on the same computer, alone against the AI, against an other computer on your wifi or against someone over the internet.
•This game can be played on a Touch Screen or a TV with an Infra-Red sensor virtually transforming a TV in a Touch Screen.
•Optimized for 4K Screens and easy to learn.

By the developer.
Hubert Cachat

boardgame.name: Heartseeker
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A 2-page traditional fantasy adventure game based on the original from the 1970s.

Inspired by games like OSE, Searchers of the Unknown and Holmes' blue book, Heartseeker has everything you need to play a classic fantasy campaign in just two pages. The game features:

A simple d20 system
Five classes and 9 bloodlines
A simplified Vancian magic system
All the rules needed to run a game
A short monster list
A creative commons license to create your own hacks

boardgame.name: Isle of the Damned
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Prince Markus is on his deathbed and only you can save him. The Isle of the Damned is said to be home to the three Sacred Chalices which could save the prince's life. Youmust venture to the Isle of the Damned and escape with the chalices.

This is a one-page point-crawl adventure for Heartseeker and other OSR games with art by the master Arnold Böcklin. A whole adventure is packed into a small space, with rumours, random encounters and new allies to make.

boardgame.name: Zero Impact
boardgame.description:
Zero Impact teaches children about environmental awareness and how their actions impact the environment.

On their turn players draws a card with an environmental impact action on it (driving every day, buying local food, etc.) then move a number spaces either toward zero environmental impact or towards environmental damage. The first player to reach the Zero Impact zone wins.

From the game description:

Zero Impact is a board game on the theme of climate change. Our daily activities, large or small, affect the environment in big ways. This game is designed to allow individuals an opportunity to learn about daily activities that can help fight climate change as well as activities that can harm the Earth. While playing Zero Impact, you will be able to learn what you should and should not do to help save the planet! If you can create a net zero impact on the environment, you can be the hero and save the Earth.

boardgame.name: Дубль. Крейзи ферма (Take. Crazy farm)
boardgame.description:
Players have to act quickly to correctly solve tasks and find the right number of certain animals (cows, donkeys, pigs).

There are 6 types of tasks and players solve 3 tasks at the same time. Answers are given with the help of cards, after which it is determined whose correct card was laid first. That player receives a quest card.

The one who first collects a certain number of quest cards wins.

The game develops quick decision-making, attentiveness and logic.



Игрокам предстоит быстро и правильно решать задания, находить нужное количество определённых животных (коровы, ослики, свинки).
Задания бывают 6 видов, определите кого из животных: ровно 5, ровно 6, ровно 7, больше всего, меньше всего или НЕ столько же, сколько других.
Игроки одновременно решают 3 задания.
Ответы даются с помощью карт, после чего определяется, чья правильная карта была положена раньше.
За правильный ответ, данный раньше других, игрок получает карточку задания.
Тот, кто первым соберёт некоторое количество карточек заданий, побеждает.
Игра развивает скорость принятия решений, внимательность и логику.

boardgame.name: Girl Genius Sourcebook and Roleplaying Game
boardgame.description:
A Gaslamp Fantasy – With Adventure, Romance, and Mad Science!

The Girl Genius Sourcebook and Roleplaying Game brings the world of Phil and Kaja Foglio's Girl Genius comics and graphic novels to your gaming table. Its contents – lavishly illustrated in color, by none other than the Foglios! – include:

- A detailed description of the setting and its history, drawing upon all available sources . . . and compiled with input from the creators themselves, meaning these pages reveal some secrets for the first time!
- A complete roleplaying game covering character creation, equipment, combat, and dramatic situations and tasks – including inventing, of course! To play, just add paper, pencils, and six-sided dice.
- Biographies and character stats for all the major characters and many minor ones, plus notes on supporting cast.
- Game stats for a wide range of clanks, constructs, and other creatures unique to Girl Genius.
- Tons of helpful advice on establishing mood, accurately emulating the comics, and running and playing the game.

The Girl Genius Sourcebook and Roleplaying Game is a complete, standalone game Powered by GURPS. While compatible with GURPS Fourth Edition, that game is not required.

- Publisher's description

listing.notes: Do you have "The Spark?" Then get on with using it, because the Heterodynes deserve to fall! This is the brand-spanking new Girl Genius Sourcebook, designed for GURPS-4E, but readily convertible for your favorite system (I'm about 1/3rd of the way through adapting to DD-3E). Two available. New store stock. My price includes shipping to any US address, including APO, FPO and DPO. Outside the US? Plan on another $25-40 in shipping costs. Sorry, but we're all aware of the barrel we're bent over...

boardgame.name: Tennis (1983)
boardgame.description:
Back of the box

Forehands and backhands, driving approach shots, angled volleys, overhead smashes and trivky lobs-you've got all the strokes in TENNIS! Plus a wicked serve that always goes where you want it. Here's the action-packed, realistic game that challenges you to play your very best.

Whether you choose singles versus the computer, singles versus another player, or doubles versus another player, the action is fast and furious. You control your position on the court and where you want to hit the ball, just as in the real0life game. The electronic scoreboard displays the results. The only thing missing from ATARI TENNIS is the sweat!

boardgame.name: Rocketmen: Rocket & Launch Pad, Earth, Moon & Mars coins
boardgame.description:
Pledge now with the Earth, Moon, Mars or All-in Pledge to receive for free the Kickstarter Exclusive upgrades for Rocketmen. Rocket & Launch Pad plastic miniatures and Earth, Moon & Mars metal coins! These replace the Rocket, Moon, and Mars tokens of the game.

---Description from Kickstarter campaign page

The coins came in a small ziploc bag while the launch pad and rocket came in a little blister.

Weights are 30 g for the coins, 40 g for the rocket and launchpad.

boardgame.description: Available as part of the Mars and All-in Pledges, the Plyer's Mat set consist of four neoprene player mats, replacing the game's player boards. They are single-sided, laser cut, and measure 56×20 cm.

listing.notes: Title: Rocketmen: Player's Mat Set Publisher: PHALANX

boardgame.name: 12-0-12: Теория Власти (Theory of Power)
boardgame.description:
Chaos reigns in the spaceship. There is no connection with the outside world. Passengers are ready to pounce and tear each other apart. Only you have the power to take over the lost ship and prevent the death of the team.

In the game Theory of Power, you need to establish control over the ship. You will need help. Collect eight Follower Passengers first to win. Attract supporters for valuable resources and poach them from rivals. Supporters' special skills will help you win faster. They need to be effectively combined with each other in order to achieve victory.

Player have 5 cards on his hand on the start of game and have 4 type of action:
1. Attract crew member to player's side, in other words place a card from hand to the table - need to pay food, how many units of food indicated on each card.
2. Discard a card to receive food (1 unit of fodd for each card)
3. Poach a supporter (a card located on the table) of other player - you need to pay influence tokens
4. New contact's search - get new cards to your hand from card deck. Each card give to player a token of compromising information (-1 point).

The goal of the game - receive 8 points (+1 point for each supporter -1 point for each token of compromising information).



а космическом корабле царит хаос. Связи с внешним миром нет. Пассажиры готовы наброситься и растерзать друг друга. Только в ваших силах взять власть над затерявшемся кораблём и не допустить гибели команды.В игре «Теория власти» нужно установить контроль над кораблём. Вам потребуется помощь. Чтобы победить, первыми соберите восемь пассажиров-сторонников. Привлекайте сторонников за ценные ресурсы и переманивайте их у соперников. Особые умения сторонников помогут победить быстрее. Их нужно эффективно комбинировать между собой, чтобы достичь победы.

4 асимметричных фракции, 2 тайных сообщества и 8 сильных лидеров создают высокую реиграбельность. Единой победной стратегии нет, побеждайте разными путями. Станьте лучшим!

boardgame.name: Muffin Time: Deluxe Edition
boardgame.description:
Muffin Time is a chaotic card game with more twists and turns than you can shake a spork at! Battle your friends, family, and hyper-intelligent pets by drawing and playing from a deck of unique cards that'll either help you, thwart others, or mix things up for the sheer hell of it! To win the game, you just need to start your turn with exactly 10 cards in your hand but if you think that'll be easy, you're wrong (wronger than a duck wearing shoes - and that's pretty damn wrong).

This follows the same rules as the regular Muffin Time game. Players draw a card on their turn and can choose to "place" up to three trap cards out of their hand. As a second part of their turn they either pick up one card or play one action card, which are all unique and can have wide-ranging consequences on the other players or game as a whole

The game ends an a player wins when someone starts their turn holding exactly 10 cards.

This deluxe version includes cards from the Pie Flavour and Rainbow booster packs so contains 200 cards (the standard 120 plus 40 from each booster).

listing.notes:
Deluxe Kickstarter version (The Bestest Kickstarter one) with all expansions to play with up to 10 players.
Played twice. As good as new. Please contact me for shipping costs.

boardgame.name: Hoplite
boardgame.description:
Hoplite is a game of tactics for 2 players, using 18 identical cards as battle units.

Defend, Attack, and Capture the enemy’s units to gain dominance over the battlefield!

Each player controls a phalanx of hoplite soldiers.
Your objective is to kill or capture enemy soldiers until your opponent is unable to make a move.

The cards are laid out on the table in a ‘basketweave’ pattern, each representing a soldier on the battlefield. Soldiers move by rotating on a corner that is touching an adjacent card; either rotating 90 degrees to touch another card, or if it is on a corner, rotating 180 degrees to align to the new edge. Each player makes two moves on their turn, which can be to move two soldiers, or the same soldier twice.

Soldiers have three possible effects when aligned against an enemy card in certain orientations:


Attack: remove the enemy from play
Defend: block an Attack
Capture: flip an enemy card over so that it joins your side


By attacking and removing soldiers from play, and capturing enemy cards, you can gain a dominant position and isolate your opponent’s cards so that they are unable to move. When they have no possible moves to make, you have won the battle!

boardgame.description: Argentinian promo for Taco Cat Goat Cheese Pizza: the capybara.

boardgame.name: Westward Rails
boardgame.description:
Westward Rails is a stock-holding and route-building game about western expansion in the United States. Three-to-five players will bid on shares in five historical railroads, use that money to build routes, connect specific cities to satisfy demands, and develop important metropolitan areas, all with the aim of securing bigger and bigger dividends for the companies in which they are invested.

Westward Rails is played on a point-to-point map, sprawling out west by connecting cities to make major profit. On your turn, you choose to build, auction, or upgrade. This continues around the table until all demands have been met or companies run out of track. Most money wins the game.

listing.notes:
GAME ACCESSORY ONLY!
Premium canvas map game accessory for Westward Rails.

boardgame.name: The Peculiar Alchemist of Alpentor (5e)
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

In the quiet Alpentor Valley, a strange dwarven alchemist named Embric peddles even stranger wares--and surprises are in store for those who imbibe his goods! In this 4th-level adventure, the heroes must venture into the alchemist's peculiar mountainside lab, investigate the oddities, and discover the source of Embric's bizarre dealings before it's too late!

boardgame.name: Scarlet Citadel Map Folio
boardgame.description:
From the back of the folio:

ALL THE CITADEL'S DARKEST DEPTHS REVEALED

The Scarlet Citadel Map Folio is a collection of all the maps Game Masters need to run the massive Scarlet Citadel dungeon-crawling adventure by Kobold Press.

The folio's maps include:


Ten beautiful, full-color battle maps measuring 24 inches by 36 inches when unfolded, each overlaid with a grid of 1-inch squares perfect for tabletop RPG miniatures.



Several 8-inch-by-10-inch overlay maps that can be placed atop the battle maps to depict unique traps, hazards, or other features of the dungeon.



Coated surfaces that can handle any dry erase, wet erase, or even permanent marker.

boardgame.name: MEGALOS Quickstart Beta
boardgame.description:
User Summary

An early access preview of MEGALOS with basic rules, a prologue campaign setting, and Basic Premade Characters to get a feel for the game.

boardgame.name: Infinity
boardgame.description:
publisher blurb

Originally developed from 1999 to 2001 by Affinix Software, the end of the Game Boy Color's retail lifespan and the market shifting towards the Game Boy Advance resulted in publishing struggles for the game. As a result, the original Affinix team went their separate ways, leaving Infinity a what-if that was formally canceled in 2002. Yet, 15 years later, following repeated interest in what was seen as one of the last Game Boy Color games, an unfinished version of Infinity was released as a free ROM in 2016.

Now, for the 20th anniversary of Infinity, we have assembled a team consisting of both Affinix originals and fresh faces, to finally complete Infinity and give it the physical cartridge release that it always deserved!

boardgame.name: Qwixx Longo
boardgame.description:
Qwixx Longo is a quick-playing dice game in which everyone participates, no matter whose turn it is. Gameplay is nearly identical to 2012's Qwixx, but with eight-sided dice allowing for higher numbers to be rolled and lucky numbers that give additional chances to mark off spaces.

Each player has a scoresheet with the numbers 2-16 in rows of red and yellow and the numbers 16-2 in rows of green and blue. To score points you want to mark off as many numbers as possible, but you can mark off a number only if it's to the right of all marked-off numbers in the same row.

On a turn, the active player rolls six eight-sided dice: two white and one of each of the four colors listed above. Each player can choose to mark off the sum of the two white dice on one of their four rows; additionally, if the sum of the white dice matches one of the two lucky numbers printed on your scoresheet, you immediately mark off the next number in the row in which you have the fewest marks.

Then the active player can choose to mark off the sum of one colored die and one white die in the row that's the same color as the die. The more marks you can make in a row, the higher your score for that row. Fail to cross off a number when you're the active player, however, and you must mark one of four penalty boxes on your scoresheet. If you have at least six numbers marked in a row, then you can mark off either of the final two spaces in a colored row (15/16 in red/yellow and 3/2 in green/blue) — assuming the dice allow you to do so, of course. If you do this, you also mark off the padlock symbol in that row, locking everyone else out of this color.

When either a player has four penalty boxes marked or a second color is locked, the game ends immediately. Players then tally their points for each color, sum these values, then subtract five points for each marked penalty box. Whoever has the highest score wins.

listing.notes: Game weight: 0.210 kg
Title: Qwixx Longo Publisher: White Goblin Games Language(s): Dutch

boardgame.name: Hearthstone - United in Stormwind
boardgame.description:
Grab your loot and get ready to make some trades in the bustling city of Stormwind! The Alliance capital has everything you need to prepare for your adventure: you can upgrade your gear, pick out a mount, or even start a new Questline. Beware, not all is as it seems in the city, but the Alliance will remain steadfast, United in Stormwind!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: The Banquet of Dusk - An Adventure In Limbo
boardgame.description:
What grief drives a man to seek their lost love across the forbidden veil of death? What price is their's to pay?

The Banquet of Dust takes adventurer's into the engulfed ruins of the Keep of Roland, there, to unravel the sad tale that sent it to the very brink of Tartarus.

This adventure is devised for the Limbus Infernum setting published by MontiDots Ltd. using old school fantasy roleplay systems. The location is easy to transfer to any other dusty setting.

There are over 100 pages of adventure spread over six maps and pupulated by new creatures and new magic.

boardgame.name: カエルの財宝 (Kaeru no Zaihou)
boardgame.description:
カエルの財宝 (Kaeru no Zaihou) can be translated to “Frog Treasure”.

A band of frogs have been sent by the Frog King to retrieve treasure sleeping within a pond to the east of the Frog Kingdom. The frogs who bring back the greatest riches will receive high praise from the King.

In this game, players move pairs of frogs around a pond to collect treasure. Treasure of varying value is hidden beneath lily pad tiles. In order to collect the treasure, a player must sandwich the lily pad tile with two of his or her frogs or stack two frogs on top of the lily pad tile.

After collecting the treasure, players should decide whether they wish to display the treasure for game points or keep it in their hand for a power boost meaning greater mobility for their frogs and the ability to collect even more treasure.

Collecting certain combinations of treasure will also result in a higher number of points (for example: collecting gems of the same color).

There are a limited amount of times a player can take action so everyone must be careful to strategically plan their actions.
boardgame.boardgamepublisher: iop games (イオピーゲームズ)

boardgame.name: Hellfire Campaigns: The Universe at Your Feet
boardgame.description:
This guide is written to help you fight wargames campaigns. The guide is written to help both the player with enthusiastic opponents but also to support the solo player as well.

Although written with Hellfire rules in mind, a lot of the campaign systems will work comfortably with any rule system you like. The rest will be be easily modifiable to cope with whatever rules or figure scale you want to use. The rules will cope with a wide variety of periods as well.

I confess that I've always regarded the wargames campaign to be wargaming at its finest. Done properly a campaign can provide far more interesting and unexpected games than just facing an equal points army across the table. This guide is written in an attempt to ensure that you manage to extract the maximum amount of fun whilst limiting the book-keeping. Whether you want to use massed heavy armour, or ride the fleeing enemy infantry down with your wild horsemen, this rule set will help you make sure it's all done in a suitably cost-efficient manner.

Combat accountancy has never been a particular love of mine and I'd hate to impose it on anybody else.

—description from the designer / publisher

boardgame.name: 2300 AD Box Set
2300AD Box Set
boardgame.description:
Publisher blurb:

Three hundred years from now, humanity is claiming worlds far from Earth. Despite nearly destroying itself in the Twilight War, despite all the wars since, humanity has held on and kept its dream alive. 2300AD is the story of that dream, as humanity reaches for the stars.

This is a richly-developed hard science fiction universe, with ships spinning against the night as they are propelled by the stutterwarp drive, a true violation of physics as we know now it. Airships, helicopters and hovercraft are common sights on worlds of the frontier, while spaceplanes and rockets carry explorers and traders to orbit, and from there starships take them across the gulf of space to the colonies.

Campaigns in 2300AD range from interstellar exploration and war on the far frontier, building new colonies on hostile worlds, discovering and understanding alien species, and engaging in espionage and crime in the gritty mega-cities of the Core worlds.

The 2300AD box set contains:

Book 1 Characters & Equipment: Everything you need to create explorers, company agents, military personnel, merchants and other inhabitants of 2300AD. This book also contains a comprehensive equipment guide, personal augmentations, and a selection of robots and drones commonly used in space and on colony worlds.

Book 2 The Worlds of 2300AD: An exploration of the universe of 2300AD, from the Core worlds to the furthest colonies. You will learn about the aliens and animals that inhabit them, how humanity has adapted to living on their surfaces, and the most hostile of environmental threats to be found beyond the Earth.

Book 3 Vehicles & Spacecraft: A full guide to operating and fighting in spacecraft and vehicles, from humble dirt bikes to powerful spacegoing frigates. There is also a glimpse at the alien spacecraft that have been encountered thus far by humanity.

Starchart of Known Space: A massive poster map depicting every star system known to humanity and the routes starships take to each.

Requires the Traveller Core Rulebook

boardgame.name: Talisman: Star Wars – 2021 Promo Card Set
boardgame.description:
A Pack of 4 promo cards for Talisman: Star Wars.

Battle Droid

Millennium Falcon

Sith TIE Fighter

Zorii Bliss

boardgame.name: Advent Shadow
boardgame.description:
It followed the story of Marin Steel, a mercenary pilot thrust into a saga of intergalactic proportions. In the midst of extracting herself from a hostile negotiation, Marin is interrupted by a planetary invasion led by monstrous aliens bent on human genocide. In her efforts to escape the dying world, she encounters young Gideon Wyeth, the protagonist of Advent Rising, and together they find themselves swept up in a massive struggle against dire forces bent on the destruction of humanity.

Majesco Entertainment suffered some financial difficulties, and due to the poor sale of Advent Shadow's console predecessor, Advent Rising, the game had been quietly cancelled.

boardgame.name: Breakneck Derby
boardgame.description:
Breakneck Derby is a fast-paced card driven horse racing game for 1 to 10 players. Thoroughbreds race around the track based on cards played into a five-card Bonus Hand. Poker and cribbage inspired card play and hand building are easily learned, but guarantee wild, competitive action where no two races are alike.

Push your horse down the straightaway by building hands. Take the inside track in the corners while blocking your opponents and pushing them outside to slow them down! Every card matters, and any horse can be moved by any player, so skillful play and a bit of luck are needed for victory. Play money and optional betting rules up the ante with head-to-head wagers and payoffs for win, place and show!

Perfect for parties, game night, solo play, or a marathon session at the poker table, Breakneck Derby is ideal for families, friends, or more "competitive" social groups!

listing.notes: Limited number of copies of Breakneck Derby available new in shrink wrap for just $50!

boardgame.name: The Cupid Crisis
Holiday Hijinks #4: The Cupid Crisis
boardgame.description:
You just made last minute reservation plans for a romantic dinner only to find out you're in for a more puzzling experience.

The Cupid Crisis, title #4 in the Holiday Hijinks line, is an escape room style game in just 18 cards! As a group, you will solve a series of puzzles to unravel a mystery.

When you have solved a puzzle, you will enter the answer into the companion web app (compatible with all smart phones and computers) and it will check whether you are correct. If you are, the app will tell you which card or cards to take next.

The app also contains a graduated hint system, so if you get stuck you can get just a small hint about the current puzzle to get moving again without giving too much away.

Puzzles may test your perception, wordplay, and lateral thinking. English language fluency is required. Knowledge of traditional American national symbols is helpful, but that information is also provided in the app if you need it.

Most groups take about an hour to solve the game. You can write on the cards to help solve puzzles, but this is not required (or you could use penny sleeves) and the game is otherwise non-destructable. So while you can't play again yourself, you could give the used game to someone else to play.

boardgame.name: Excavation Earth: Junk Tiles Promo Pack
boardgame.description: The Junk Tiles add a new type of rare artifact into the game that allows players to sell items with greater ease and flexibility.

boardgame.name: Excavation Earth: Deluxe Alien Metal Coins
boardgame.description:
52 metal coins in 4 (or 5*) denominations especially designed for Excavation Earth. Can be used for any other game.

Material: Zinc alloy.

1 x 16 coins
5 x 8 coins
10 x 16 coins
50 x 12 coins
100 x 1 coin (KS Exclusive*)

boardgame.name: Дикий кросс (Wild Cross)
boardgame.description:
(eng. Wild Cross)

Foxes love to run around. They can't wait for the hedgehogs to clear the sunny path to race.

To win, the player must bring three foxes to the finish line in a certain order. Foxes will earn as many victory points as they can catch rabbits.

There are five colored foxes in the game. Before the start of the game, the hidden goals of each player are determined which foxes should come to the finish line (one of the foxes will be a bonus). In addition, tokens of hidden rewards in the form of rabbits for the first, second and third fox who have come to the finish line are placed.

By rolling the dice, the players determine which foxes are running, using all kinds of bonuses on the field (apples - we additionally move another fox, mushrooms - we move another fox back, holes - allowing you to jump from one path to another path, hedgehogs - which block the victory point for a caught rabbit).
The game ends as soon as the third fox reaches the finish line. After that, points are calculated for the caught rabbits.

boardgame.name: Dart Bros vs Zombos
boardgame.description:
Dart Bros vs Zombos is a 1-4 player, cooperative darts game that puts you in the hero role. Be a Dart Bro (or Sis) and help save fleeing people from the Tinkerbrians and their horde of terrifying Zombos.

Each player chooses their own darts skill level (novice, expert, or pro).

The horde is created out of the Zombo deck.
The cards will tell you where your targets are
Fire 3 darts each turn to eliminate the incoming Zombos
Each round more Zombos appear and move closer towards you
If bitten, lose a dart. Lose 3 darts, you are eliminated
Use special item cards strategically to help ensure victory


To win, use your skill and strategy to make it past the Tinkerbrains and their Zombos while saving as many people as you can. Add up your points to see how well you did and who is the best Zombo slayer on your team!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Clash of Armies: Medieval – Terrenos
boardgame.description: A 8-card terrains expansion for Clash of Armies: Medieval. Control these grounds to get benefits for the battle.

boardgame.name: Hitler's Last Gamble: Designer Signature Edition
boardgame.description:
Hitler's Last Gamble, Designer Signature (2nd) Edition is Danny Parker's final effort to create a memorable game on the Battle of the Bulge. The scale is conventional: 2 miles per hex, battalions and regimental units; two turns per day. However, the game has many innovations never before seen. Day and night turns differ dramatically both with respect to movement and the likelihood of decisive combat. All units are rated for Morale which can often be more important than combat strength. Forced marches and fluid zones of control at night are a major German offensive weapon while the Allied air effort influences German movement. The game has many previously unseen influences: V-1 weapons attacks, weather impacts on combat (and even zones of control) and bridge discovery.

As you would expect from a Danny Parker game the Order of Battle for both sides has been exhaustively researched (evaluated in a detailed numerical fashion) and several new units and many changes to others. Besides the new morale rules, armor superiority from the original has been retained although combined arms is enhanced and artillery influences are significantly changed. There are many changes to movement based on weather conditions.

The map in the original game included all of the villages in the Ardennes. The new map now includes not only those villages but also all the hamlets and castles. A study of the 1940 census has resulted in some towns being downgraded to villages and some village upgraded to towns. The contour lines in the original game are now gone and severe terrain has been added based on detailed evaluation using Google Earth. The map has been expanded to include more area in both the north and south. There are three maps with one smaller one devoted to the Battle Before the Meuse scenario
The Game Booklet includes scenarios, Designer’s Notes, Game Variants, Examples of Play and the Game as History. Also included is a Historical Background Booklet with Historical Analysis and Summary, Detailed Orders of Battle, Evaluation of Combat Strengths in the Ardennes and Design Bibliography. With perhaps more detailed historical background than any game to ever see print, HLG will also be a great reference tool.

More than just a reworking of the original game, this version is really a brand new game that has seen constant work for nearly four years by a dedicated team. The research on every aspect of the game has been truly monumental.

Of course there never will be a 'last word' in Bulge games, the subject is far too popular. But this game pushes the envelope far forward.

—description from the publisher

COMPONENTS:
Two 34x22" map sheets and one 25x21" map sheet
Six countersheets (5/8" size)
Rules booklet
Historical background booklet
Scenario booklet, Variants & Designer Notes
16 player aid cards
Axis order of appearance displays
Allied order of appearance displays
Two six-sided dice
boardgame.boardgamefamily: History: World War II (Battle of the Bulge)

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Deep Space D-6: The Long Way Home
boardgame.description:
The Long Way Home is a hybrid Tabletop RPG supplement for use with the Deep Space D-6 board game. The story begins with your ship stranded in unknown space in the aftermath of an ambush. With limited fuel and a failing warp drive, you'll travel through the galaxy, explore strange new worlds, make difficult choices, and ultimately find your way home to the United Earths headquarters. A player sheet tracks your progress, provides ship upgrades, and outlines the traits of your unique crew.

Each turn, you'll decide where to travel, spending precious fuel to get there. Events and encounters outline the stipulations of combat. Occasionally, you'll have to make a choice. These choices can be modified by your crew, skill checks, and previously made choices. Can you unravel the mysteries of them galaxies and get your crew back home safe?

boardgame.name: Priorities
boardgame.description:
From the publisher
Priorities as a party game of extreme honesty and absurd choices to target player ranks every day object cards from love to loathe. The other players work together to try to predict a target player’s order. It’s everyone versus the game

boardgame.name: Horizon 1
boardgame.description:
Horizon 1 is a solitaire science fiction settlement-building game of strategy, resource management, and above all, growth and survival.

This game is an entry in the 2021 Solitaire Print and Play Contest.

Overview:

Priority 1: Establish and develop the Horizon 1 settlement on planet Cerberus.
Priority 2: Maximise settlement population.
Priority 3: Extract as many minerals as possible from the planet crust.

Your settlers make planetfall on Cerberus, 2.6 light years from Earth. As the Governor of the Horizon 1 settlement, your task is to ensure their safety, to build facilities in which they can live and work and, most importantly, to research and understand this strange new world.

Turn structure:

The game is played over a series of game turns. Each game turn consists of a number of phases, performed in the order below.

Resource collection phase. Collect food and ore resources.
Research phase. Check if scientific breakthroughs occur, and (optionally) change research focus or projects.
Movement phase. Move units, explore terrain, prospect, and move aliens.
Building phase (optional). Use Engineer (ENGINR) units to build / demolish modules.
Combat phase. Any aliens present engage colonial militia in combat.
Event phase. Draw and resolve an event card, and flip the Day / Night counter.
Status check phase. Update position of status counters on the status board. Do an approval check.


The game ends immediately when any of the following conditions occur:

The Life support module is destroyed.
Settler rebellion occurs.
There are no cards remaining in the draw pile of event cards.
Settlement population (POP) reaches zero.


When the game ends, your Victory Points (VPs) total = population + ore mined. Some event and technology cards also provide VPs.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Hearthstone - Ashes of Outland
boardgame.description:
Peer Through the Dark Portal

From the last bastion of civilization on a shattered world, Illidan Stormrage beckons. Join ranks with the fabled Illidari Demon Hunters while wielding powers forged from the surrounding chaos. Slay rampaging demons, crush the Rusted Legion, and rise from the Ashes of Outland!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Hearthstone - Madness at the Darkmoon Faire
boardgame.description:
Come One, Come All

Just beyond our auspicious arch, a fantastic festival filled with tantalizing sights, treats, and challenges awaits you. Though, heed not the many blinking horrors beckoning from shrouded alleyways, for these otherworldly terrors would have you miss the petting zoo! Welcome to the Madness at the Darkmoon Faire!

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Hearthstone - Scholomance Academy
boardgame.description:
School’s in Session

Within the lofty halls of the prestigious Scholomance Academy, the next generation of great fire flingers, axe swingers, and doom bringers study under the scrutinizing eye of Headmaster Kel’Thuzad. Whatever your martial or magical pursuit, the academy has the training grounds and study halls to transform you into the hero you’ve always known you could be. Just be sure you steer clear of what the Cult of the Damned may be meddling with beneath the campus grounds…

Source: The Game Website.

boardgame.name: Arkham Horror: Broken Token Player Board
boardgame.description: Protect your stat tracking from bumps and jostles without obscuring important character information.

boardgame.name: Fågel, fisk eller mittemellan
Fugl, fisk ellers midtimellem
boardgame.description:
This game is for you if you love fin challenges mixed with crazy facts and Wild guesses. It is a fast paced game which is all about answering the more than 300 deeply inspiring questions. In every round two players needs to guess a number as close to the correct answer as possible, while the rest of the players listen. When the two players reveal their answers the remaining players can adjust their answers. Will it be higher, lower or somewhere in between?

—description from the publisher (translated)

boardgame.name: Red Death
boardgame.description:
From the description:

The second adventure for Harper's Quest.

The Red Death has swept across your homeland. Death surrounds you and your townsfolk. This plague kills without mercy. Its victims can feel fine when they rise, and by mid-afternoon gasp their last breath. Blood pours from their mouths and eyes as the fever overtakes them. Most die by choking on their own blood and vomit. The style of death has led to the illness being named Red Death or Blood Fever.

You are a serf. Your Lord, Cryptic the Younger fears for his life and begins to take drastic measures. Your family, while out for an errand finds itself captured by the cowardly Lord. As you plead for their release, Cryptic sends you, and you alone, on an errand to seek out a rare herb said to prevent the worst of the Red Death.

Rescue your family. Avoid the Red Death.

boardgame.name: Castle of Chronos
boardgame.description:
Enter the Castle of Chronos...

The first supplement and expansion for Harper's Quest. Fight your way through an evil Chronomancer's keep as you try to find your lost friend and mentor, Feynrol. Keeping true to Harper's Quest form, Castle of Chronos is a quick, rules-light, OSR style, solo, dungeon crawler. And of course, it fits in your pocket!!

boardgame.name: Tomb of the Theurge
boardgame.description:
Enter the Castle of Chronos...

Lamenys was the most feared necromancer Esseallon had ever seen, and when she died with her terrible plan to raise every corpse in the land unfinished, there was much rejoicing. So much rejoicing, in fact, that the matter of what do to with her hidden stronghold was forgotten in the revels.

The dreaded Compendium of Lamenys - her spellbook, the source of her malefic power - is still down there, waiting for some enterprising ne’er-do-wells to recover it. Some enterprising ne’er-do-wells like yourselves…

Tomb of the Theurge is a trifold pamphlet dungeon and the first of the Little Coffins series. Each Little Coffin is compatible with BRIGHTHAMMER (@hyvemind), Bastards. (@micaholism), The Vanilla Game (@infinite_mao), PINKHACK (@monkeyspawgames), and other OSR games.

boardgame.name: Stanisław Moniuszko
boardgame.description:
Players learn Stanisław Moniuszko's biography on the board while completing their own hidden goals pointed out on the goal cards. To complete these goals players should find a match between two opened biography cards. Everything happens simultaneosly so try to find match quicker than the opponents. The first player who'll "live" Moniuszko's life wins.

This game is inspired by the creators of "Snappy Dressers".

•••

Planszowa zabawa dla dzieci i dorosłych.

Życie i twórczość Stanisława Moniuszki to bogaty materiał na niejedną książkę czy film. A co dopiero przełożyć to na język gry. Autorowi tej, Karolowi Madajowi, udało się połączyć element edukacyjny ze swoistym napięciem, które towarzyszy każdemu grającemu – chęć wygranej. Frustracji nie przysparza nieznajomość faktów z życia kompozytora. Gdzie podróżował, co i kiedy komponował, rytmikę jakich tańców narodowych wprowadzał do swoich utworów, gdzie mieszkał w Warszawie – tę część, pomocną w czasie gry opracowała dr Hanna Winiszewska. Jeśli chcesz wygrać, to przeczytanie tych informacji z instrukcji jest elementem obowiązkowym.

Gra wydana została z okazji Roku Moniuszki.

boardgame.name: Паўстанцы (Rebels)
boardgame.description:
Historical card game which helps you to return back to the times of 1863 Kościuszko Uprising in Belarus. You can take either a role of one of the famous persons (Kościuszko himself, Valery Urubleŭski or Mikhail Myravyov) or ordinary Belarusan citizen who still can impact the rebellion progress.

The game is based upon people interactions, pointing out and defending your opinion. Cheating, bluffing, deceiving and butchering one another is a player's right.

Translated from publisher

boardgame.name: Гаспадар цмокаў (Host of Dragons)
boardgame.description:
Nowadays everybody seemed to forget that the first beast to be tamed by a man wasn't a dog or a cat, or even a horse — it was a dragon! It gave it's master assistance in finding food as well as protection. And the worthiest man was the one who owned five dragons. In order to tame them you have to be fast, attentive and fast-witted.

Complete the tasks on the cards, tame the naughty dragons, collect all the five dragons (aquatic, aerial, terrestrial, underground and ultimate) to win the game.

•••

Прыручайце гарэзлівых цмокаў, станавіцеся іх сябрамі, разам ахоўвайце свае землі ад шкоднікаў і не давайце адзін аднаго ў крыўду старэйшым. Мы верым, што вясёлыя і абаяльныя істоты з радасцю стануць часткай вашага сямейнага вечара або далучацца да шумнай сяброўскай кампаніі.

boardgame.name: Karigar-e-Taj
boardgame.description:
You will play the role of a Karigar (Artisan) and strategically place your workers to gather the material you need in an ever-changing market. And you are not alone. Rival artisans seek the Emperor's favour too. Gather goods and mohurs (coins), optimise your resources to fulfil your secret blueprint objectives and use your resources wisely to build the Taj level by level to earn bakshish (gifts) and Taj points from the Emperor.


Build your strategy to earn the maximum Taj points by completing various levels of the Taj Mahal.
To complete each level of the Taj, you need specific resources.
Place your workers on spaces that will yield historically authentic resources you can use or trade.
Capture Special Marketplaces that will expand your pick of resources and generate revenue for you.
When you have the resources you need, build a section of the Taj. You might just end up helping your opponents meet their bonus objectives. Is it worth the risk?
Each level you build yields Taj points and Baksheesh (gifts) from the Emperor.
Watch out for the market and your opponents. It evolves as soon as a section of the Taj is built, and your rivals can use this against you.
The game ends immediately when the last Taj tile is built.


The player with the most Taj points at the end of the game wins!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Iconoclash: LevelMAX
boardgame.description:
Iconoclash: LevelMAX is a stand-alone expansion and features 4 new, cross-over fighters for the Iconoclash system from Level 99 Games:


Zsolt: This relentless hunter never ceases, releasing his flurry of attacks with his arsenal of weapons. There’s no escape!
Khadath: The master of the portal takes to the battlefield and assumes control. By summoning his Gate Trap he can attack from any range.
Deques: Is your deck ready and do you want to duel? After studying the meta game for years, Deques has readied his deck of trading cards for any situation. Summon all sorts of monsters to become the champion!
Esfir: Bring down the house with this hothead who controls gravity. She sends her opponents flying into the stratosphere, creates blackholes, and inverts gravity with a snap of her fingers.


In LevelMAX you'll take the fight to the world of Seventh Cross with Mansion of Darkness and the Gilded Foyer maps.

boardgame.name: NBA 2K22
boardgame.description: Sports

boardgame.name: METALLIC CHILD
boardgame.description: METALLIC CHILD is a rogue-lite, core-action game, featuring Rona, an android known as “Metallic Child,” taking place in a space laboratory in the latter part of the 20th century.
boardgame.videogamehonor: 2021 Operation Rainfall Awards Best Indie Game of the Year Winner

boardgame.name: Cats collection (あつめねこ )
boardgame.description:
A large number of cats are coming to the backyard. Show them your yummy foods to invite the cats into your home! However, if your food is not so unique, the cats will go away. Now it's time to choose your foods.

Players use rice cards to collect cats. If you collect the most cats, you will win! The rules are simple, just give out a different card and call a cat! Atsumeneko uses Japanese-English bilingual notation on all cards and instructions.

boardgame.name: Doctor Who: The Edge of Reality
boardgame.description: TV show

boardgame.name: Car Mechanic Simulator 2021
boardgame.description:
Start as a fresh owner of a car garage and work your way to a service empire. Get your hands dirty in a super-realistic simulation game that has incredibly realistic detail. Get ready to work on 4000+ unique parts and over 72 cars. Roll up your sleeves and immerse yourself in a crazy-real garage environment.

Source: The Publisher Website.

boardgame.name: Escape from Danger Dungeon
boardgame.description: Escape From Danger Dungeon, a co-operative board game based on the Tunnels and Trolls RPG system. Can your band overcome the foes and traps which block its way? Can your band discover an exit before being buried alive? Can your band avoid squabbling over the loot? you can find out!

boardgame.name: Robot Boxing League
boardgame.description:
An arena fighting deck builder in a world where robots have replaced human boxers. Choose one of six characters each with unqiue themes, abilities, and starting decks. When you pick your fighter select one of 5 game modes to play in ranging from solo up to a three vs three mode.

The game is divided into two phases the battle and market phases. During the battle phase you play cars at the same time as your opponent. These can range from dealing damage, moving your robot, or blocking your opponent. Once each player has no more cards to play it goes to the Market Phase.

During the market phase you gain credits used to buy from or alter the market. Use your credits to add more cards to your deck, Upgrade your robot, or clean the market.

During gameplay you can earn titles to gain more credits or other bonuses. Don't fret if you get to zero health. Each robot can reboot and continue the fight. Be wary though each reboot has negative consequences on your robot.

Will you be the next RBL Champion?

boardgame.name: Dodos Riding Dinos: Chicken Warfare Promo Card
boardgame.description: This promo was included with the Kickstarter Exclusives that were delivered for War for Chicken Island.

boardgame.name: Countaloupe
boardgame.description:
Your goal in Countaloupe is to rid yourself of slice cards as quickly as possible, and whoever clears their plate first wins.

Each player starts with slices numbered 1-16. On a turn, you roll 3-5 dice (depending on your current top slice) and the chance die. After your roll, if any single die or the sum of any number of dice matches your top slice, you remove it; keep removing slices as long as the numbers add up. If, for example, you rolled 1, 2, 5 at the start of the game, you could remove the 1, 2 & 3 slices.

You now either end your turn or roll again. If you roll again and fail to remove a slice, you must place slice cards back on your deck as a penalty.

The chance die may give you the opportunity to swap decks with another player — or force you to swap with whoever has the largest deck! Alternatively, you might gain the Nope! token and use it to block a deck, whether to keep an opponent from removing cards from it or to protect your deck from being stolen.

Countalope can also be played as a multi-round game, with players scoring 1 point per card removed, with a game ending when someone has 16 points. Whoever reaches 100 points first wins.

boardgame.name: Quill: Shadow & Ink
boardgame.description:
From the description:

In 1887 a book was bought at auction that would change the world. The Vir Stellas, a 16th century magical occult tome has been unearthed and is about to set into motion a chain of events that spans 30 years.

Shadow & Ink is a cosmic horror campaign for the award-winning Quill: A Letter-Writing Roleplaying Game for a Single Player. Take on the roles of scientists, journalists, students and more as you uncover the secrets behind the Vir Stellas through five interlinked scenarios. Set out on a journey of terror as you collect story points to determine your eventual fate.

This version of Shadow & Ink has been re-layed out with new art and some clarifications. The download also includes a vintage map of Providence County and printable art deco paper templates.

A copy of the Quill rules is required to play this supplement.
boardgame.rpg: Quill: A Letter-Writing Roleplaying Game for a Single Player

boardgame.name: Killers: the card game
boardgame.description:
To begin the game, you deal out your stable of 5 infamous killers to each player. On your turn, you will draw a victim card, decide which killer will abduct the victim, roll a die to determine if the abduction is successful, and then roll for the kill. During this time you will be able to use special weapon cards or scenario cards to effect gameplay.

At the end of all players turns, the police will come around to investigate any evidence left, by a dice roll, or apprehend any killers with 3 or more found evidence tokens.

The game is won when one player reaches 10 kills or is the last killer standing.

Part RPG, Part Collectible, All Card Game... this may be the last game you ever play...

boardgame.name: M.A.S.H.
boardgame.description:
MASH has been brought back from the past and transformed into a hilariously fun, adult party game! A quick 10 to 20-minute game is perfect for anytime you want to play.

Thousands of different futures are possible since MASH includes 300 Fate Cards in 6 unique categories and 40 Scenario Cards, making the game endlessly playable!

Players lay down your picks under the MASH and the fortunista picks their favorite and you get points if yours is picked. The player with the highest points wins the game.

listing.notes: Brand New. Never been opened. See photo.

boardgame.name: The Game of Life / Pay Day
boardgame.description: The Game of Life and Pay Day in one tin.

boardgame.name: Deluxe Domino Dice
boardgame.description: In Deluxe Domino Dice, each player in turn rolls up to seven domino-style dice — imagine two six-sided dice connected into a rectangular shape — and tries to place as many of them as possible following standard domino rules. The more dice you place, the more points you collect. You can re-roll once during your turn to try to place more dice, but if you can't place any, then you score nothing for that entire turn.

boardgame.name: Endurance: Le Jeu – 24h Le Mans
Endurance: The Game – 24h Le Mans
boardgame.description:
During 6 intensive rounds, draw and play cards to score points that represent your lead in the race. If you choose to draw a card, then you have to play a card from your hand.

Watch your Engine !
If you collect 3 or more Overheating Points in a round, you trigger an Engine Overheating, and score zero point for this round.

Sometimes, it is better to have a pit stop during a round. Your score falls to zero, but you lose all your Overheating Points and you can still play to regain a few points before The round ends.

The 24 Hours of the Mans is an endurance race: The winner is the player that manages to keep their engine running until The finish Line!

boardgame.name: Die Erbauer von Teotihuacan
Fondateurs de Teotihuacan
Founders of Teotihuacan
Fundadores de Teotihuacán
boardgame.description:
Travel back in time to the founding of one of the greatest cities of Mesoamerica and become a part of its history once again. Design the foundations of a great pre-Columbian civilization, with its buildings, temples, and a grand pyramid in the center. Find perfect locations for production buildings and great temples, and build the might of the great pyramid overlooking your city. Establish yourself as the very best among competing architects, and your project will secure you a spot among the great Founders of Teotihuacan!

Founders of Teotihuacan is a strategy game where you compete against your friends to create the best design of the city of Teotihuacan. Over the course of three to four rounds you will place your action disks to the main board, forming towers of varying strength, strategically use the bonuses they offer, and construct temples, resource buildings and the pyramid central to your project of Teotihuacan. You will balance generating resources and using them, as finding good locations on your city board becomes increasingly more difficult, and you will try to outwit your opponents, making use of an innovative and interactive action system. Finally, once the eclipse comes, all designs will be assessed and the player with the most points will win and become the architect to join the ranks of Founders of Teotihuacan!

Founders of Teotihuacan is a stand-alone game, related to Teotihuacan: City of Gods only by the shared setting of the ancient city of Teotihuacan. Thematically, the events in Founders takes place at an earlier time in history, while what was to become a magnificent city was yet in its infancy and only few inhabited the area.

On your turn, you must either perform an Action or pass. To perform an Action, place between 1 and 3 of your Action disks on an Action space on the Main board that already contains at least one disk (minimum a Bonus disk and possibly also opponent disk(s)), and carry out a corresponding Action. The Action disk(s) should be placed on top of the disk(s) already on that space, forming a stack. Each Action space can hold a maximum of 4 Action disks—including Bonus disks!

Your personal player board is divided into four Districts or quadrants. Buildings and Temples can only be placed within the two Districts closest to your Architect. Pyramid tiles can only be placed within the six Pyramid squares closest to your Architect. Your Action Strength is equal to the total number of disks (whether yours, an opponent’s disks, or Bonus disks) on an Action space.

After performing an Action (not when passing), move your Architect clockwise to the next side of your Player board, signifying
the end of your turn. This changes your Architect's Reach for your next turn. After all players have passed, the current round ends.

After the game has ended, players score additional Victory Points for how well their Districts complement their Pyramid.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgamepodcastepisode: Episode 87: Llama Land, Founders of Teotihuacan, Meadow, The Dark Quarter, Kohaku - Top 5 Games That Begin With ”M”
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Founders of Teotihuacan: Extra Bonus Disks

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

listing.notes:
New in shrink wrap.

NOTE: The shipping costs for deliveries outside of the EU and UK have been discounted to make up for the fact that no VAT is paid for sales outside of the EU and UK. However, there may be import taxes for deliveries outside of the EU and UK, and the buyer is responsible paying these.
[b]Combined Shipping:[/b] The shipping cost for multiple items will be: 8 Euros within Germany. 15 Euros to Luxemburg and Malta. 16 Euros to Cyprus and Romania. 17 Euros to Austria, Bulgaria, Estonia, France, Monaco, and Slovakia. 18 Euros to Belgium, Czech Republic, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Netherlands, Spain, and Switzerland. 19 Euros to Italy and Slovenia. 20 Euros to Albania, Belarus, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Faroe Islands, Greenland, Iceland, Ireland, Macedonia, Moldavia, Montenegro, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Serbia, and Ukraine. 21 Euros to Finland and Greece. 22 Euros to Croatia, Denmark, and Sweden. 24 Euros to Hungary. 26 Euros to the United Kingdom. 32 Euros to Israel, Russia, and Turkey. 38 Euros to Canada and the USA. 40 Euros to Australia, Brazil, China, Indonesia, Japan, Malaysia, New Zealand, Singapore, South Korea, Taiwan, and Thailand. 50 Euros to Mexico and Vietnam. 52 Euros to everywhere else.
