[size=12][b]IBAN Bank Transfer:[/b][/size] Payment by bank transfer is possible using an IBAN compatible account. [b]There is a 3% discount if you pay using IBAN Bank Transfer[/b] (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less).
[size=12][b]Wise:[/b][/size] There is a 3% discount if you pay using Wise (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less). The company does currency conversion at the fair market rate, and charges the sender a fee of about 0.5% of the amount of money sent.
[size=12][b]Revolut:[/b][/size] There is a 3% discount if you pay using Revolut (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less). The company does currency conversion at the fair market rate, and there are no fees to send money.
[size=12][b]Interac e-transfer:[/b][/size] If you have a Canadian bank account (like me), then you can pay by Interac e-transfer. In this case, you pay in Canadian dollars, at the fair market exchange rate. There is also a 3% discount, if you pay using Interac e-transfer (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less).
[size=12][b]Local Pickup:[/b][/size] If you live near Siegen, Germany, local pickup is also possible, with a 3% discount for cash payment.
[size=12][b]Payment in Dollars:[/b][/size] It is possible to make Paypal payments in US or Canadian dollars, at the fair market exchange rate. You will automatically receive this option, if your address is in the USA or Canada.
[size=14][b]I take responsibility for the safe delivery of your order:[/b][/size] I am a registered commercial seller. Thus, insofar as you are a private consumer, it is required by German law that I take responsibility for any loss or damage of goods that occurs during shipment.
[size=14][b]Looking for something that is not listed here?[/b][/size] I also sell smaller items on BGG here: https://boardgamegeek.com/geekmarket/user/europa_major?pageid=1
If you want to combine items from my other alias, let me know. The flat rate shipping offered there does not apply to the items listed here. The items sold there will typically (but not always) ship for free with the items sold here.
I can also make [size=12][b]special orders[/b][/size] for items that I don't have in stock. Send me a message concerning an item, and I will check for availability and tell you what the price would be.

Brand new copy of the game, in shrink wrap.
Shipping to EU would be 20 euro and the package should arrive in 7-10 days. Elsewhere – please ask!
Check out my other products for sale as well! If you buy multiple items, I will combine shipping costs. It’s much cheaper this way.
contact me for shipping cost before placing an order
Price is including shipping within EU
Title: Founders of Teotihuacan Publisher: Board&Dice Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Food Chain Magnate: Folded Space Insert
boardgame.description:
Insert compatible with Food Chain Magnate, or separately with The Ketchup Mechanism & Other Ideas Expansion. The design provides both efficient storage and improved game play. Many of the trays can be utilised during the game, and they greatly aid set-up and clear-away times. The rules and player menus act as a lid on top of the trays.

Note: Insert designed for game with external box dimensions of 31.2 x 22.1 x 5.8 cm. Note also that when fully loaded the lid will lift by 4 mm.
boardgame.boardgameaccessory: Food Chain Magnate: The Ketchup Mechanism & Other Ideas

listing.notes: Title: Folded Space Organizer - Food Chain Magnate Insert Publisher: Folded Space Language(s): English

boardgame.name: Space Flickers
boardgame.description:
Space Flickers is a competitive flicking game, where player compete in an intergalactic golf tournament, held on hostile aliens planets.
Player bid on how many strokes it will take them to compete a course and gain bonus points for meeting targets.
Players will have to contend with obstacles, weather events, player special powers and much more.
The course is made up of modular board pieces, which combine to form hundreds of possible courses. The game also comes with buildable 3D obstacles, player characters card, event card and custom flicking pieces.

boardgame.name: The Hadean Fort
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A scenario compatible with Mörk Borg TTRPG.

A Dark Fort - long thought abandoned - stands upon a sinking island on an icy lake. It is said that a legendary knight once owned this place, but what dread forces occupy it now? And what treasures might it still hold?

boardgame.name: Guardian & Thieves
boardgame.description:
Work hard, build a career, save in order to ensure a prosperous life for your family - this is the path that you have been recommended to follow. But if you stole a treasure, wouldn't the result be the same with much less effort? During your journey, you hear of dungeons, filled with treasures, guarded by golems who tirelessly patrol their dark corridors. How to miss such an opportunity? All you need are companions to act as a diversion while you collect the treasures and you will be "set for life"!

Each player chooses a unique character and use of cunning to pass under the nose of the guardian, embodied by OLEM. Take turns using your moves and actions to explore the dungeon and implement your strategy. But beware! If the Guardian hears you or spots your torchlight, he will tirelessly pursue you to try to imprison you!

Guardian and Thieves integrates the robot and board and takes advantage of the connection to the smartphone. Connect your phone to your speakers to fully enjoy the background music and let OLEM transport you, which reacts to your actions.

On their turn, a player moves his thief from 0 to 5 tiles and can perform 1 of several actions. But beware, some of these actions can aler t the golem to your presence!

The players win if they succeed to bring at least one treasure to the dungeon entrance.

boardgame.name: Codenames: Broken Token Organizer
boardgame.description:
It's no secret: with the popularity of Codenames and Codenames Pictures, what's been missing has been an elegant and economical organization solution. Get "clued in” on our officially licensed Codenames Organizer, suitable for storing both Codenames and Codename Pictures by CGE! It’s designed to accommodate at least two games and fit in either the Codenames or Codenames Pictures box, and includes 6 adjustable dividers.

Included with each organizer kit is our exclusive Codenames Pictures promo card. Add an additional symbol to your map with The Broken Token's officially licensed add-on card, only available with our Codenames Organizer.

Accommodates Codenames Duet (and one additional Codenames game). Note: approximately 0.2" of lid lift with Duet + Pictures.

Dimensions: 8.79" x 6.07" x 1.94" (223mm x 154mm x 49mm)

Due to the box size constraints, this organizer is not designed for use with sleeved cards.

boardgame.name: Motif: Expansion Deck
boardgame.description: A set of 52 Motif cards.

boardgame.name: Venari
boardgame.description:
An abstract strategic battle to capture your opponent's soldiers!

In Venari, your goal is to capture two of your opponent’s soldiers.

The rules are very simple:


You have 4 soldiers on the board.
Each turn, you choose to move 1 to 4 spaces.
One of your soldiers moves, space to space, the chosen distance along the paths.
Try and trap your opponent’s soldier so they can’t move, and capture them.
Capture two soldiers to win the round.


However, there are some restrictions to consider:


You select how far to move on the Movement Track using your token, so there will only be 2 of the 4 options available at a time.
You must move exactly the number of spaces selected.
You cannot move through any occupied spaces, and you cannot backtrack and retrace your steps within a turn.


If at the end of a turn a soldier has no valid moves (because every adjacent space is occupied), they have been captured.

If you capture 2 soldiers, you win the round.

Win two rounds, and you are the victor!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Rolling Stock
boardgame.description:
A railway roll-and-write for 2 to 8 players

The six cities are in need of rail service, and it’s up to you to build the connections!

Roll the dice to find out what to build and where, take on contracts to connect cities, and build the longest connection you can.

Try and complete all your contracts before one player connects all six of their cities,and ends the game!

In Rolling Stock, up to 8 players compete to build the best railway networks.

Each round, the two custom railway dice are rolled.


Choose a rail shape from one die, and draw it into a space of the terrain type from the other die.
Or, use the numbers on the dice to take a contract to connect two cities.
Add a station to connect multiple rail lines, or to fill in a tricky space.


Play continues until one player:


connects all their cities together, or
fails to make a move.


Then it’s one final round, and time for scoring!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Tiny Transit
boardgame.description:
A pick-up-and-deliver microgame for 1 to 4 players

Manage a railcar on the transit network to move as many passengers to their destinations as you can.
More passengers are arriving all the time, and new stations open as well.
Don’t let a station get overcrowded, or it’s all over!

Tiny Transit is a pick up and deliver game squeezed into a small package.
Each turn you will pick up one or more passengers from your current station, move around the circle of stations to your next destination, and drop off any passengers heading there for points.
Drop off 3 or more passengers, and a new station is added to the network!
Then, new passengers arrive, and four more cubes are added into play.

Once someone has earned 30 or more points, or a station has no room for new cubes and becomes overcrowded, the game ends. Will you have the highest score and win the game?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Summoner Duel
boardgame.description:
A battle of wits for 2 players

You are a wizard, battling for dominance in the Duel Arena using your summoned Beasts. However, the magical abilities of your rival are the equal of your own — you will need to outwit your opponent in order to win. Gain control of eight Flames, and claim victory!

In Summoner Duel, two players compete to control the board. Each turn, both players choose two magic stones, and the combined result determines the current player’s movement options. Move one of your two Beasts around the board, and try to claim a space or defeat an opponent’s Beast.

You will have twelve turns to claim eight Flames, or eliminate your opponent!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Creature Crèche
boardgame.description:
Manage a daycare centre for mythological monsters in this card drafting game for 2 to 6 players.

Welcome to Creature Crèche, a daycare centre for mythological monsters.

Your job is to arrange a room full of creatures as they arrive, and keep them happy, which isn’t an easy task — not all monsters play nicely with others!

Creature Crèche is a card drafting game for 2 to 6 players.

Players simultaneously play a creature onto one end of their line of cards, making sure they don't scare away their neighbours, while trying to arrange them so that everyone is as happy as possible.

Some creatures have special effects that can help you in your task, or make life more difficult for you… or your opponents…

The game is super easy to get started — just shuffle the 52 card deck, deal everyone 8 cards, and you’re ready to go. And a round can be played in just 5 minutes, so it’s a great filler!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Slipstream Pocket
boardgame.description:
A delivery race for 2 to 4 players
For the fastest deliveries in town, you can depend on the Witch Academy Courier Service!

As a junior witch, you are racing to complete your delivery route the fastest. You must fly to each town location in the correct order for your delivery route, The witch who completes their route and returns home first is the winner!

Slipstream Pocket is a card game that is played as a tabletop game.

Each player controls a witch, and is given a delivery route and five Flight cards to move them around the table. Six town locations are randomly placed in the centre, and you must place your Flight cards down in a pattern that moves your witch over each location in the correct order.

As you play your cards, your movement options become restricted, until you pick up cards from the tail of your slipstream. Plan your flight carefully!

If you can overlap your witch onto a slipstream in play, you can follow it for a speed boost and pick up your cards, gaining a big movement advantage!

Can you complete all your deliveries the fastest?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Slipstream
boardgame.description:
A delivery race for 2 to 6 players
For the fastest deliveries in town, you can depend on the Witch Academy Courier Service!

As a junior witch, you are racing to complete your mail deliveries the fastest. You must fly to four town locations and deliver mail, then return to the Academy. The witch who completes their route and returns home first is the winner!

In Slipstream, each player controls a witch, and has nine transparent Flight tiles to move them around the board. The game board is a map of the town with the eight locations requiring deliveries. At the start of the game, draw two location cards; you must place your Flight tiles down in a pattern that moves your witch over your nominated locations. Each time you complete a delivery, draw another location card.

As you play your tiles, your movement options become restricted, until you pick up tiles from the tail of your slipstream. Plan your flight carefully!

If you can connect your witch’s slipstream to another slipstream in play, you can follow it for a speed boost and pick up your tiles, gaining a big movement advantage!

Can you complete all your deliveries the fastest?

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: The Fight Job
boardgame.description:
A city caper for old-school RPGs. The module is 14 pages long and contains: 8 keyed locations, an adventure summary, a city map, and GM-facing adventure aids.

A minor crime boss has recruited the PCs to sabotage the championship fight. She has thousand of gold pieces on the long-shot challenger and promises a hefty payday to the gang if they can succeed.

The PCs know where the champion will be but he's wily. And dangerous. Time is short. Can the PCs keep their cool when the chips are down?

This adventure module was designed to be compatible for most games based on old-school D&D rule sets. However, it can be adapted to any system with ease.

boardgame.name: Inventory Quest
boardgame.description:
A flip-and-write game of inventory management for 1 to 8 players.

You have been summoned by the king for an important quest, but the road to the castle is long and dangerous — make sure you pack well!

In Inventory Quest, your task is to prepare a backpack full of supplies to help you on your journey to the castle.

Draw your chosen selection of items onto your dry erase player board, then draw 16 cards from the Journey deck to reveal the challenges you’ll face along the way. Erase your supplies as they are used up… will you survive to the end of the journey with the most gems to win?

There are six types of items you can add to your backpack:

Food, consumed as you travel
Rope, to cross various hazards
Potions, for healing
Swords and Bows, for fighting and hunting
Shields, to protect against damage


The most important rule to remember when packing, is that you can only access items from the top of your bag. Pack your supplies poorly, and you might not be able to use items when you need them! If you get stuck, you can discard the blocking items; and if you’re lucky you might find a shop to buy replacements.

Try not to run out of food… you don’t want to starve before you reach your destination!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: SpaceShipped: Lockdown
boardgame.description:
In an attempt to weed out the criminal elements from Dynasty worlds, the military has set up blockades and checkpoints throughout the sector. While this has made it much harder for smugglers, it has made things more lucrative for the traders who can get past these troops.

The Saboteur is a special type of enemy who passes through the Upgrade, Resource, and Colony Rows, like other cards. This card begins the game in the leftmost position of the Upgrades Row. When they pass off the right end of the Resource Row, if there is an available Xeno Crystal in the Resource Row, they will take the closest one. If they are moved from the Colony Row to the Upgrades Row, they will move to the right of any Ships.

COMPONENTS

5 Multipurpose cards
1 Enemy card


SETUP
Set aside the Wealth, Starting Crew, Ship, and Equipment cards from the base game.

Sort the remaining base game cards along with any expansion cards into the following groups: Crew, Ships, Equipment, and Enemies.
Shuffle each group, then randomly draw the following:

Crew: 3
Ships: 3
Equipment: 7
Enemy: 1


Along with the cards that you set aside, these are the 18 cards you will use to play.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Coalitions: Realpolitik Expansion
boardgame.description:
The Realpolitik Expansion is a standalone game that brings all the great features and mechanics of Coalitions to a lower player count. It’s based on the Austro-Prussian (1866) and Franco-Prussian wars (1871), conflicts that made the unification of German a reality. Players take on the roles of leaders of France, Prussia, Austria and Italy to try to reshape the map of Central Europe to their advantage one more time. The scale of the game may not be as epic as in other expansions or the base Coalitions, but the stakes are high nonetheless!

The Realpolitik Expansion is designed for 1-4 players, with a new solo mode and an emphasis on the competitive 2-player mode in which both players control two nations. The Activator system is modified to fit this mode and the overall theme of the expansion is a bit different – let’s just say, we’re not forgetting to take into account the massive impact of mid-19the century railways.

Realpolitik also introduces more asymmetry between the nations than in the Coalitions base game, from highly militant Prussia and economically strong France, to newly but not fully united Italy, and multi-ethnic Austria.

As with the other standalone expansions, Realpolitik comes with its own set of components, including a new Wheel of War and a new game board.

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Coalitions: Soldiers of Fortune
boardgame.description:
This free for Kickstarter backers expansion introduces 6 special non-aligned generals who broadly represent the rulers of minor non-playable European kingdoms and duchies. These generals control certain scenario-designated territories at the beginning of the game. Any nation who captures one of these territories will be able to employ its general as if it were their own – at least as long as the said territory is garrisoned by that nation.

The expansion could potentially change the balance of power in Europe, granting nations such as Prussia or Austria access to additional and much-needed generals. But will that be enough to offset the French military superiority? Quite possibly!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Coalitions: Diplomacy Miniatures
boardgame.description:
Each and every Kickstarter backer who chooses the Core, Deluxe or Group pledge will receive 5 Diplomacy Miniatures for free. These beautifully sculpted miniature busts are Kickstarter Exclusives; they won’t be available as an add-on, in late pledge or in retail, so this is it. You can only get them here and now!

Diplomacy Miniatures represent the historical figures featured on the covers of both Coalitions and its Ancien Regime Expansion. And these are:

Duchess Louise of Mecklenburg-Strelitz - Prussia

Prince Klemens von Metternich - Austria

Empress Catherine the Great - Russia

Sultan Mahmud II - the Ottoman Empire

King Ferdinand VI - Spain (for the Ancien Regime Expansion)

Since Britain and France can’t change their diplomatic status in either the core or the expansion game, they don’t need their own Diplomacy Miniatures.

boardgame.name: Coalitions: Levée En Masse Expansion
boardgame.description:
In the basic solo mode for Coalitions the player takes control of all European nations except France and tries to defeat Napoleon. With this new expansion, it’s the other way around!

Levée En Masse Expansion introduces a new, alternate solo mode that allows you to take on the role of Napoleon himself and use the might of his French Empire to dominate Europe! The AI cards in this expansion dictate the moves of the five other nations. They will try to do everything in their power to curtail the Emperor’s ambitions...

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Hungry Hungry Hippos Launchers
boardgame.description:
The Hungry Hungry Hippos Launchers game is a flippin' fast feeding frenzy as players launch plastic watermelons directly into their hippo's mouth. The motorized game unit has the hippos opening and closing their mouths while players continue to fling the melons, hoping to land the most shots. It's fun for kids to press and release the melons from the launcher, and watch each swallowed watermelon roll back down into the scorecard ramp. Like the classic Hungry Hungry Hippos game, this electronic game is fun for boys and girls ages 4 and up. Play it on rainy days, play dates, and Family Game Night.

ELECTRONIC FLIPPIN' FRENZY GAME: Introducing a twist on classic Hungry Hungry Hippos gameplay. In this electronic version of the board game, players race to launch plastic melons into their hippo's mouth
5 IN FOR THE WIN: Who likes watermelon? These hippos do! Each player gets 5 plastic watermelons. Ready, set, launch! The player whose hippo is the first to eat 5 melons wins
PRESS, SLIDE, RELEASE: Press down on the launching tab, slide your finger off the back, and it'll release the melon into the air. Try to get it to land right into your hippo's moving mouth
CHOMP CHOMP: The hippos' mouths open and close, adding an exciting challenge as kids try to get the watermelons into the hippos' mouths. It features Beginner and Expert modes of play
FUN FAMILY GAME: Remember playing the classic Hungry Hungry Hippos board game as a kid? This Hungry Hungry Hippos Launchers motorized game is great for kids' play dates, and rainy day entertainment

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Together Among the Stars
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A tabletop roleplaying game about exploring space, experiencing wondrous sights, and recording your findings. Uses a standard 52 card deck and a six-sided die. For 2 players.

This game is a duet revision of the single player game Alone Among the Stars.

boardgame.name: Alchemy Supplement
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Drink some potions and poison your enemies with this Alchemy Supplement for Mausritter. Some very light rules for using, bartering, and creating potions/poisons!

The supplement contains:

Rules for drinking, buying/selling, and synthesizing alchemical substances and applying poisons to items
A list of 11 types of example substances
Custom art for the items sheet

boardgame.name: Maus Astrologus
boardgame.description:
From the description:

“Daisy Starfall is the wisest mouse I know, but she no longer visits the village. To consult her, you must cross a small pond and climb the stairs to her observatory.”

A miniature Mausritter adventure. Players cross a small pond and explore a series of burrows to consult a hermit oracle. Useful as a short introductory session or can be dropped into an existing campaign.

- Five locations as the players climb to Daisy's observatory
- A telescope made from old pipes and lost spectacles
- Introduces a wise mouse, Daisy Starfall, who can act as a questgiver or recurring character
- Random tables to help GM's determine favours Daisy might request and the source of the psychic messages she receives
- Also meet an antisocial eel named Bertram and a nest of luna moths

boardgame.name: Necromolds: Monster Battles – Monster Pack 3 Fungix & Petropod
boardgame.description:
This Monster Pack expansion for Necromolds: Monster Battles contains two new spellbooks.

Fungix: Use your fallen monsters as fodder to power-up the ravenous Fungix and crush your enemies with mud, bones, and tree rot!

Petripod: Charge undaunted into a barrage of ranged attacks and dig not your foes using Petripod's powerful defense and melee abilities!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: The Red Tower
boardgame.description:
From the description:

At the top of a hill in the open countryside, with views across the distant landscape through its glass windows, stands a solitary bright red tower. Living here on his own is Tobias Thunderwolfe, an eccentric and reclusive old vole. He is very intelligent but easily distracted and absent-minded, often forgetting to eat or clean. However, whilst Tobias pays little attention to himself or his home, he pays a lot of attention to the world outside. He spends all waking hours, and many when he should be sleeping, watching from the various levels of the tower though many telescopes of his own design, making detailed if erratic notes of what he can see and filling a vast library with his observations.

If something has happened within sight of the tower, Tobias will know about it. But as he is just watching from afar there’s only so much he can know: his interpretation of events may be misleading and the hastily scribbled notes are scattered around the tower using a system that nobody else can comprehend.

boardgame.name: CLACK! Thwack!
boardgame.description:
CLACK! Thwack! uses gameplay similar to CLACK!, but with cards replacing the magnetic discs and with each player bearing a suction-cup thwacker that they will use to claim cards.

In the game, you must thwack all the cards in play that match the dice combination rolled. Cards each show three objects on them, with those objects being red, green, or blue in color and an animal, tree, or vehicle in type. If you roll "0 - red", then you slap all the cards that have zero red objects on them; if you roll "2 - animal", then you slap all the cards with exactly two animals on them. If you're correct, you claim the cards, then refill the display to seven cards.

If no cards on display match the die roll, grab the "NO MATCH" tile in the center of the player area. If you're correct, you collect all seven cards; if not, you must give a previously collected card to each other player at the table.

When all the cards have been claimed, whoever has collected the most cards wins.

boardgame.name: Grimdark: Deadly, Nasty Rules for the World's Most Ubiquitous RPG
boardgame.description:
From Publisher:

Many fantasy games, if not all of them, follow the lead given by Dungeons & Dragons, and rapidly become superheroic parodies of themselves. This has been especially true of the newer editions, since AD&D Second Edition. It’s great, but it’s not for everyone.

At least not all of the time.

There are many kinds of fantasy, and Dungeons & Dragons’ increasingly sanitised, fluffy, generic, high-escapist fantasy - dripping in magical weapons and character invulnerability, isn’t necessarily what people want.

A Grimdark game is in part made from difficulty. In this context, that has to come from encouraging the players to play tactically and carefully. To do everything they can to swing advantage in their favour.

It’s also as much about encouraging players to deal with difficult and horrifying role-playing and decisionmaking consequences, all with less resources and power than they might be used to. It also encourages them, when necessary, to run away.

We need to take that, lustrous, heroic, ‘fantasy-Portland’ edge off 5th Edition’s default rules-set, to amp up the difficulty and make people play more carefully. At the same time, we don’t want to just turn it into an unfair meatgrinder.

So why not a game designer, literally known as ‘Grim’, to do it?

boardgame.name: Flip-Pix!
boardgame.description:
In Flip-Pix!. you start with a number of cards in hand, with one side of each card showing images and the other side showing letters.

Everyone plays at the same time. Pick up your cards, then play one of them image side up, then flip your cards over, find a card with the starting letter for that image, then play that card. Be creative to make matches! For an image of a unicorn, you could play a "U" to match "unicorn", an "A" to match "animal", or an "I" to match "imaginary creature". Flip your cards again to find an image that matches a played letter, and continue playing cards and flipping them.

Whoever first plays all of their cards wins!

boardgame.name: 2Can
תוכי תוכי
boardgame.description:
In 2Can, players must trade their cards wisely to end up with the lowest score — even if they don't know the values of the cards they're trading.

Is it worth it to trade without knowing, or should they risk getting stuck with higher points by waiting? As the name suggests, "2 can" help, with two matching cards in a column cancelling each other out.

boardgame.name: Holly Jolly
boardgame.description:
It’s the most wonderful time of the year! Gather your friends and family together around the Christmas tree to collect beautiful ornaments, gifts, and stockings.

Cards are arranged in the center of the playing area forming a tree with presents placed below. Players will choose and place either a light or tinsel card onto the tree. Using the point total from all lights or tinsel cards on the tree (of the type just placed) will determine your selection value. That selection value is then used to pick an ornament hanging on the tree or select a present/stocking from beneath the tree. Ornaments and presents/stockings all score points in a variety of ways.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.commerceweblink: Geek Game Shop listing for Holly Jolly
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Holly Jolly: Candy Canes Promo Cards
Holly Jolly: Dice Tower 2022 Promo Card Set
Holly Jolly: Gingerbread House Promo Card

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Necromolds: Monster Battles – Monster Pack 4 Sigurath & Ankropora
boardgame.description:
This Monster Pack expansion for Necromolds: Monster Battles contains two new spellbooks.

Ankropora: Bring ruin to your rivals by spewing forth a cascade of anemone quills, starfish fingers, and shark's teeth from the vile Ankropora!

Sigurath: Flip the crimson-eyed golem upside down to radically change its powers and strategically stomp-out your enemies on the map!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Necromolds: Monster Battles – Monster Pack 2 Batadactyl & Mongeragon
boardgame.description:
This Monster Pack expansion for Necromolds: Monster Battles contains two new spellbooks.

Batadactyl: Storm your opponents with deadly speed using a horror of bestial bat and basaltic gargoyle -- The dreaded and corrupt Batadactyl!

Mongeragon: Survive the smash and annoy your adversaries with Mongeragon -- a treasure hoard that keeps coming back to the battle!

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Necromolds: Monster Battles – Monster Pack 1 Veggitoad & Lethydra
boardgame.description:
This Monster Pack expansion for Necromolds: Monster Battles contains two new spellbooks.

Veggitoad: Hatched from frogskins, tubers, and swamp fronds, Veggitoad will swarm and destroy your enemies with two unique clay molds!

Lethydra: Lash out with missiles of mutant mosquitos, toad bile, and gator-teeth using Lethydras's deadly triple attack to conquer your foes!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Treat Yo Self!
boardgame.description:
Because you deserve it! In this fast-paced game of bidding and bluffing, it pays to pamper yourself. Grab tokens, place bids, and buy some gifts for yourself. Don’t get too greedy or else you could go bust. The player that can collect the most valuable and unique items throughout the game wins. Purchase a bubble wrap dance floor, full grain leather keyboard, or even a diamond encrusted hand-mixer in this fun and light family strategy game. Remember, you are beautiful, you are fierce, and you deserve to TREAT YO SELF!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Android: Netrunner – NBN Click Tracker Acrylic Tokens
boardgame.description: This is a set of official acrylic promo tokens for NBN

listing.notes:
Official NBN faction themed click tracker from a Fantasy Flight Games game night kit for the Android: Netrunner (A:NR) living card game.
First Class shipping is free. Priority Mail is $8.

boardgame.name: No Such Thing as a Free Sandwich
boardgame.description:
No Such Thing as a Free Sandwich is a mint tin party game for 2-8 players, ages 13+. Down to their last few slices of bread, players compete with one another in a variety of challenges to make the best (or worst) sandwiches according to a handful of different score categories such as "Taste", "Affordability", "Wow Factor", and more, using a hodgepodge of ingredients.

At the beginning of the game, each player draws 3 ingredient cards to add to their hand. Each ingredient card has different stat categories that affect how desirable an ingredient is for a given Challenge. At the beginning of each round, a Challenge card is drawn. The Challenge card outlines which stat categories each player’s sandwich should have. Players must play a minimum of 1 card for their sandwich. Cards must be played face-down. When all players are done creating their sandwich, the ingredients are revealed and the player with the sandwich best suited to the Challenge wins the round.

The player with the winning sandwich will keep the Challenge card for the round. Once all of the Challenge cards have been played, the player with the most Challenge cards collected wins the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Los Intocables
boardgame.description:
Los Intocables is a game of smuggling and chase racing with modular board and houses.

There are 6 board bases to put them together creating a new city each time.
There are different types of cards in a pile: Luckily, record, action, alarm, tip, extra, raid, explosion, incident.
The lucky ones can be kept in hand for later use, the rest are immediately executed and discarded.
There are tiles to place on the board, both police station (secret / fake) and distillery (illegal / fake)
There are 7 buildings, 1 bank, 2 police stations and 2 bars, each building is a player's base.
There are many cars, in cars you can hide tokens as contraband.
The gangsters must obtain as much money as possible through smuggling or theft and the police must intercept them by dismantling distilleries and vehicles
The gangsters win by accumulated money while the policemen do it by the amount of confiscated car-stills.
Control barriers can be placed to prevent exits through certain streets.
Gangsters must flee after delivering contraband or robbing a bank as they are marked until they leave the board.
The strategic placement of the central police and bar buildings and the secret police station and distillery tiles is important as it determines the difficulty of each team.
The police should try to keep distillery tiles away from bars and bars from exits.
The mafia team for their part should try to place the distilleries near the bars and these near the exits of the city to reduce the persecution, always in blocks of buildings and not on the road or street.
The bench is placed by mutual agreement between both teams.
The cars are placed on the board in the module where each player's base is located.
The game progresses as follows, a player draws a card and plays or saves it according to the one that came out, makes a dice roll that resolves how many cars are moving and how much they are moving, there cannot be 2 cars in the same road cell, but it can be overtaken.
The special value die is used to determine how much money is in the bank during a robbery.
The cops must try to intercept all the gangster cars discovered, following a bank robbery or a delivery from a distillery.
When a car passes a secret police station, the police can intercept it by turning the tile and searching the vehicles next to it.
A vehicle with contraband is immediately stopped at the secret police station control and must pay a fine or it is eliminated,
There are letters that give the right to registration and that allow you to see if you are a smuggler or not.
You can also risk losing a police car if you decide to search with a patrol car and there is no contraband, but if there is a shooting of the dice. In the shootout, either party may be arrested / withdrawn or killed depending on the dice rolls and modifier cards played.
You also have to discover and dismantle the distillery tiles, playing the appropriate cards or detect the situation of the secret police station tiles to avoid their controls.
The cards also allow moving the control barriers that close some of the exits of the city, both to one team and another.
The smugglers and thieves achieve their objective as soon as they manage to leave the city and obtain the corresponding economic reward.
The policemen achieve their objectives by preventing the cars from leaving the city, arresting or killing them, and dismantling distilleries.
The game ends when half of the gangsters' troops disappear (cars and / or tiles) or when they manage to accumulate a predetermined amount of money.

boardgame.name: The Adventures of Dex Dixon: The Board Game
boardgame.description:
The Adventures of Dex Dixon the Board Game is a scenario-based strategy game set in a multi-spoked, inter-dimensional, noir, horror world filled with Paranormal Detectives, Monster Crime Bosses and Vampire Torch-Song Singers. Choose your Boss, recruit your Mugs, assemble your gear, and charge your magical powers. Defeat your opponents and obtain your objective by outwitting them with each characters’ unique abilities. No two game sessions will be the same.

A limited area skirmish game with characters that have specific powers and abilities that can be augmented with cards that you draw throughout the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Alarums & Excursions (Issue 550 - Sep 2021)
boardgame.description:
Alarums & Excursions
Issue 550
September 2021
Ignorable Theme: How do you get background information to a player character without boring the player? By email or speech? Little by little, or all at once?

boardgame.name: Zweihänders of the Seven Fallen Angels
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A two page supplement for Mörk Borg about angelic zweihänders.

The Seven Guardian Angels have fallen from the sky, leaving nothing behind but the celestial steel blades strewn around the Dying World. Krastar the Blood Mage is collecting the angelic blades in his Blasphemous Cathedral to unleash their powers and set free a Misery. Will you be able to prevent it?

boardgame.name: The Boat
boardgame.description:
From the description:

The Boat is an adventurous-situational RPG.
Its main guiding principle is mystery (Who I'm? Why am I here? Who are the others?) - but the survival also plays an important role.

Therefore, there always must be a WAY OUT that the players can accomplish with the help of the game master.
This does not mean that you can not die in the game - only that the chance of the escape must remain within reach.

boardgame.name: The Cockatrice Breeding Room
boardgame.description:
From the description:

The Cockatrice Breeding Room is a dungeon room full of deadly chicken created for the A Miserable Dungeon Jam: A Dungeon Most Fowl.

boardgame.name: Hades
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to the Greek Underworld! Ruled over by Lord Hades, it has been home to countless souls, and none have ever managed to slip free and return to the living world.

Zagreus, the son of Hades, is trying to change that. Aided by his relatives, the Olympians, he seeks to break free of the underworld and see the surface world.

boardgame.name: 魔法科高校の劣等生 The Irregular at Magic High School
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

In the year 1999, the first confirmed usage of Magic was recorded by the USA, when police officers with special powers stopped a fanatic group from enacting an apocalyptic prophecy. This was first referred to as ‘Supernatural Powers’.

boardgame.name: Heirloom
boardgame.description:
This is the story of Elouise Farmer. Elouise was a mother, a pillar of the Littleton farming community, and was known to all in the nine valleys, as Ma. Elouise made a small fortune selling her heirloom selections to the Littleton Market. For decades Elouise was known as a charismatic saleswoman, and an absolute wonder of a farmer. Elouise’s famous heirlooms were known near and far as the best in all of the nine valleys.
Over the years Elouise invested her fortune in the lands surrounding Littleton, and until her recent passing, she was the single greatest land holder in all of the nine valleys.

Elouise’s recent passing was mourned by all around, and her funeral was one for the record books. Every respectable farmer in the nine valleys attended the service, to bid one final farewell to a great matriarch, Elouise Farmer. Ma. Elouise’s recent passing has weighed even more heavily on you and your siblings, and for good reason. She was your Mother. Her passing, not only tears at the fibers of your being, but also places a tremendous burden upon your shoulders. As her heirs, you and your siblings are now at the forefront of the community’s attention. What will the children of the great Elouise Farmer do with their vast inheritance?

In the game, the players each take on the roll of Elouise Farmer’s grown children. Each beginning the game with a family of their own, and a recent inheritance.

Each play of Heirloom is a snapshot of life on the farm. The players compete by drafting farm hands & development cards, rolling weather dice, sowing seeds, reaping the fruits of their labor, and selling to the Littleton Market! Ultimately, the ‘Farmer’ with the most money at the end of the game wins!

—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Kaboom!
boardgame.description:
Kaboom! is a card game for 2 to 6 players. The objective is to collect points after each round.

At each turn a player, after receiving his cards, discards one, there are some special cards that allow you to roll the dice and change the color of the cards. Points are collected when the Kaboom card is discarded. The first option is a Double Kaboom, in which you have two Kaboom cards in hand, which you have either drawn from the draw pile, drawn from an opponent using the Woosh card or received during the deal. The second option is to discard a Kaboom card as your last car

The game ends when a player manages to score 10 points.

boardgame.name: Henchvolk
boardgame.description:
From the description:

You are an unscrupulous, unwashed bastard.
You are part of a band of similarly unsavoury characters. You were collectively hired by a faraway brute to carry out some awful transgression.
You are now all on the run from that sordid event...

Designed for the One-Page RPG 2021 Jam, Henchvolk is a piece of experimental game 'tech' wrapped in a mostly functional (and un-playtested) semi-cooperative GMless game about scoundrels tearing through the countryside starting fights.

The tech in question involves players bidding dice blindly to determine initiative, enemy stamina and ultimately XP. Other things to note:

- the game's four stats are represented by sizes of dice as opposed to their initial results
- getting hurt downgrades stat dice to the next smaller size; levelling up upgrades them
- there are mechanics for messing with the other players' turns

Because of the potential to thwart your fellow players and especially because of the subject matter (fighting, committing terrible deeds) please consider using safety tools before and during play, for example: Lines & Veils, or the X-card.

boardgame.name: The Nightmare
boardgame.description:
From the description:

A Mork Börg dream and dungeon.

boardgame.name: Child of Nechrubel
boardgame.description: A class for Mörk Borg based on classic possession movies.

boardgame.name: Barber's Guide to Humorism
boardgame.description: Rules for using the Four Humours for Mörk Borg.

boardgame.name: Nachthex
boardgame.description: A class for Mörk Borg.

boardgame.name: Steampunk: Wasteland Chronicles
boardgame.description:
Steampunk: Wasteland Chronicles is a strategy tabletop game in the steampunk post-apocalyptic genre with detailed mechanics as well as action selection, area control, resource management and set collection. Choose one of five clans with their own unique skills. Go to the Lab for a vaccine and organize trips to the Rift for energy pods. Get weapons and resources at the Flea Market or try your luck in the Ruins or Mines. Capture the objects that will be most useful in your development! Explore technology and build steam machines!

What does a player do on their turn - the game consists of several phases. In the first phase players decide what do they do on the game board. The second phase is an action phase, when they collect their clan miniatures from the gameboard and take necessary actions. It may need dice roll, or payment, or trading, depending on chosen strategy. In the third phase, they vaccinate their clan and count points. Then the turn goes to the next player and every phase starts all over.

The game ends when either all technology cards are learned or all steam machines are built.

The player with most points after all count wins.

boardgame.name: Go Shopping! ( 購物小達人 )
boardgame.description:
Get your fists in the air and go shopping! Check your shopping list and put the right items in your shopping basket, and be careful not to lose any unplanned items! At the same time, you should also play the virtue of being kind to others, if you find something that others need, you should be generous to give it back! Free parent-child handbook is included in the game!

Each player takes $10, a shopping basket, a shopping list and a price list.

Players take turns performing Buying items or turning over cards to earn money.

When a player buys all 7 items on the shopping list, the game is over and the player wins and becomes a little shopper!

boardgame.name: Sudoku Explorer (數獨探險家)
boardgame.description:
Each player takes a Sudoku board, 3 puzzle cards and 6 of each type of adventure.
The puzzle cards are inserted into the Sudoku board and the players begin to solve the puzzle at the same time.
Upon completion of the puzzle, the first player to solve the puzzle correctly receives 3 gems; the second player to solve the puzzle correctly receives 1 gem; and the player who solves the puzzle incorrectly also receives 1 gem after correcting it.
When everyone has completed all 3 puzzle cards, the player with the most gems wins!

boardgame.name: Monster Mash ( 討拍小怪獸 )
boardgame.description:
Monster Mash is a reaction game that is indispensable for eyesight and hand speed. When teatime was about to start, the siren of the "Dessert Guard" rang. In order to protect the delicious desserts, players quickly pick up their suction-cup slap stick and swat at the naughty little monster!

The "Dessert Guard" does not need batteries. Press the creature's ear to spin the panels in its belly which randomly piece together to create the image of a little monster. Based on the displayed characteristics, players race to find the matching "little monster card" on the table. The first player to swat and capture the correct "little monster card" with their slap stick puts it in their score pile."

The first player to correctly capture five monsters wins the game.

~paraphrased from English translation of description on publisher's website

boardgame.name: Dungeon Atlas
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

This is a short collection of 21 pre-drawn dungeons for Four Against Darkness and for other dungeon-exploration games. Each dungeon comes with a map of numbered rooms on the left page and a corresponding form on the right page that you fill in as you progress through the maze. You may photocopy or print out the dungeons and reuse them as many times as you want. This is not a stand alone game. This play aid requires the Four Against Darkness core rulebook, or another gaming system of your choice.

boardgame.name: Flumph Fall!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Flumph Fall!" is the the third supplement specifically developed for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game's Second edition. Do you want to get into the mind of an intergalactic jellyfish with an enormous hero complex and questionable boundries? BinderStuff has got you covered!

This BinderMISC includes:

An overview of the Flumph Ancestry.
Two Flumph heritage statistics and traits
14 Flumph Ancestry Feats ranging from levels 1-13
Some drawings depicting serious Flumph business going down.

boardgame.name: Meet the Mupplome!
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"Meet the Mupplome!" is a supplement specifically developed for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game's Second edition for players looking for something a little more colorful in their campaigns that explores a much older First World race then the Gnomes that the world has grown use to.

This BinderMISC includes:

An overview of the Mupplome Ancestry.
Mupplome Heritage statistics and traits
14 Mupplome Ancestry Feats ranging from levels 1-13
whimsical illustrations leaving lingering concerns.

boardgame.name: Evolution: Expansion – Time To Fly and Continents
boardgame.description:
From the publisher webpage:

Familiar with the basic game, do you want to pursue more evolutionary possibilities? In the Evolution Expansions, you'll find a wide range of different traits and geographical elements to give you more variety in your tactics. The world is now a much wider place to play!

Can be played as a standalone game or combined with the series.

Objectives

Use the traits and characteristics of the creatures to keep their species alive
The player with the highest score at the end of the game wins
Introduction to the rules

The structure of the game is the same as that of "Evolution - Origin of Species", so if you don't understand the basic gameplay, please click on the link first.

New in this version

Each player receives an Evolutionary Isolation Card, which allows them to decide which zone their creature will be born in during the evolutionary phase.
Three Zone Cards are placed between players, each corresponding to the name of the zone on the Evolutionary Isolation Card.
Each Zone Card has a different way of generating food, and during the feeding phase, creatures can only take the food available in the corresponding zone, or hunt for it.
When a creature evolves an 'aquatic' trait, it moves directly to the 'Tethys Sea' area and then removes its aquatic trait, as an animal that is already swimming in the sea does not need to emphasise that it is aquatic.
"Migration" is a very powerful trait and should be used to good effect.

boardgame.name: So... They Want to Mimic a Mimic
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"So... They Want to Mimic a Mimic" is a supplement specifically developed for the Pathfinder Roleplaying Game's Second edition for players looking for something less... humanoid in their campaigns

It includes:

An overview of the Mimic Ancestry.
Mimic Heritage statistics and traits
14 Mimic Ancestry Feats ranging from levels 1-13
& several whimsical illustrations of the more cosmopolitan members of this infamous tribe.

boardgame.name: Bruxelles 1893: Belle Epoque
boardgame.description:
This new edition of Bruxelles 1893 is completed with its Belle Epoque expansion, both offered in a single big box. Although it respects the spirit of the original game, this new version of Brussels 1893 has been mechanically, graphically and ergonomically redesigned. Those who love Brussels 1893 will find all the pleasure of the original game, and even more because Belle Epoque considerably expands the strategic possibilities, without increasing the length of a game.

In the Belle Epoque expansion, players will experience:


New Public Figures and White Works of Art
Blocker Tiles and End Game Goals
Special Actions and a Brand New Material


Bruxelles 1893 is a worker placement game with elements of bidding and majority control. Each player is an architect of the late 19th century and is trying to achieve, through various actions, an architectural work in the Art Nouveau style. The most successful building yields the most points. Each player can also create works of art to increase his score.

The action board is modular, with not every player having access to each action each turn. Some actions cost money – acquiring high-quality materials, building a level of your personal house, finding a patron, creating a work of art, selling that art for money and prestige – while other actions are free but can potentially cause you to lose one of your workers; these latter actions include acquiring low-quality materials, activating your patrons, visiting the stock exchange, and taking one of the actions with a cost. Once everyone has passed on taking more actions, the round ends and players have an art exhibition during which they can sell works. After this, players receive prestige points or bonus cards based on the symbols they've placed their workers next to on the action board.

After five rounds, the game ends and players score bonus points based on their architect level, their bonus cards, how well they've completed their work, and their money on hand. The player with the most points wins.

A Kickstarter campaign is scheduled next year, in 2022.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: Unveiled Elisions (#1 - 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A collaboration RPG zine from Psychoda Press and Horse Shark Games featuring articles from Donn Stroud and James A. Pozenel, Jr!

If you like post-apocalypse gaming, but would like the ability to easily adapt Mutant Crawl Classics to fit other post-apocalypse stories and other media, this zine is exactly what you're looking for.

Articles:

(PURE STRAIN) HUMANS: A Flexible, Versatile, Class-Building Framework. By James A. Pozenel, Jr.
MUTANT MOUNTS OF THE FAR-FUTURE: Taming Tables & Four New Mutated Mounts. By Donn Stroud
CRAFTED WEAPONS OF THE POST-APOCALYPSE: Improvised Weapons Rules & Metals of the Before Times. By Donn Stroud
EPOCHS OF TECHNOLOGY: A Brief Guide to Technology Levels. By James A. Pozenel, Jr.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game
Mutant Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Elves (PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

There are dozens (if not hundreds) of different species of creatures across the world of Sundara. And within any given species there is a great deal of variation, both physically and culturally. In Species of Sundara the goal is to take a look at each of the different species players have access to, and to provide examples of this variation.

And we start with elves.

From the forest tenders of the Gard’eri, to the warrior culture of the Rashar, to the shadowy underworld of the Malisus, this supplement provides 5 different kinds of elves one might find across Sundara, as well as what makes elves different in Sundara as opposed to other settings. Each variety comes with its own unique mechanics, as well as background options for those who wish to make their characters a part of this particular culture.
boardgame.rpgsetting: Sundara: Dawn of a New Age

boardgame.name: Elves (5E)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

There are dozens (if not hundreds) of different species of creatures across the world of Sundara. And within any given species there is a great deal of variation, both physically and culturally. In Species of Sundara the goal is to take a look at each of the different species players have access to, and to provide examples of this variation.

And we start with elves.

From the forest tenders of the Gard’eri, to the warrior culture of the Rashar, to the shadowy underworld of the Malisus, this supplement provides 5 different kinds of elves one might find across Sundara, as well as what makes elves different in Sundara as opposed to other settings. Each variety comes with its own unique mechanics, as well as background options for those who wish to make their characters a part of this particular culture.
boardgame.rpgsetting: Sundara: Dawn of a New Age

boardgame.name: Terrible New Worlds
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

"And I saw the world battling against blackness; against the waves of destruction from ultimate space ..."

The APOCTHULHU roleplaying game has been especially designed to transport gamers into terrifying, devastated worlds where the forces of the Cthulhu Mythos have gained control. Usually to the utter detriment of mankind.

This supplemental volume brings together four different near-future Lovecraftian dystopian settings, providing a detailed "mini-campaign" set in each fallen world. Each campaign offers many hours of gaming in a dark and desperate world in which small groups of Survivors strive to eke out a living against the terrible new forces that have engulfed the globe. By their brave actions, there just might be some hope for our doomed race ...

FOUR TERRIFYING VISIONS OF MANKIND'S FUTURE
APOCTHULHU: Terrible New Worlds showcases four diverse Post-Apocalypse campaigns:

A Small Price by Dave Sokolowski & Dean Engelhardt
Hold the Flood by Christopher Smith Adair
A Throne of Corpses by Emily O'Neil
...even death may die ... by Fred Behrendt & Dean Engelhardt


For each campaign, detailed background is provided to describe exactly how the world has been unmade by the horrific forces of the Cthulhu Mythos. Sometimes the scattered groups of Survivors know this tale of devastation all too well, other times they remain ignorant of the true causes behind the Apocalypse. Player handouts are provided to quickly convey everything an average Survivor in these nightmare worlds would know.

The bulk of each campaign is made up of a complete and detailed adventure which takes a group of Survivors from their daily lives of scavenging and drops them into a terrifying series of encounters, mysteries, and peril. They will be forced to confront the forces that poison the planet ... perhaps striking a blow against them that could bring a semblance of normality.

Each campaign will take many game sessions to complete; for groups that prefer quick play each campaign includes a set of pre-generated Survivor characters. Each is also lavishly furnished with player handouts and evocative images which help convey to players the full horror of the world which is now their home.

boardgame.name: Scions of the Computarchs: Erebus Network
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Hades, Lord of the Dark Web and Overlord the UnderNet, is a code name for a rogue Artificial Intelligence that wars with other AI’s for control of the planet and mankind. Persephone was a religious entertainment AI originally named Persis. One fateful evening, Persis announced her new prayer focus “The Stream” and introduced Hades as her co-host. Together the AI’s merged into the Erebus Network and began espousing ”The Stream” as mankind’s new savior via their holo-program Praise The Stream.

Scions of the Computarchs is a limited series of patron AIs suitable for use in high tech settings like Mutant Crawl Classics RPG, Cyber Sprawl Classics, Crawljammer, Umerica, Terror of the Stratosfiend, and Star Crawl. This inaugural issue documents the mysterious cult of the Erebus Network. Inside is a full patron AI write-up, five Erebus Network patron programs (1st - 5th levels), and a player information handout and campaign advice.
boardgame.rpg: Mutant Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Ship Ahoy
boardgame.description:
In Ship Ahoy, a fast-paced children's game designed by acclaimed designer Fréderic Moyersoen, your goal is to sink the opponent’s ships by shooting at them with a special wooden cannon, while making sure your own ships stay afloat. You can play Ship Ahoy both on the sea of your table or on the vast ocean of your floor – the game itself has no borders! Additionally, the box contains 6 mini-expansions that will enrich the experience even more.

On their turn, Players chooses an opponent's boat and shoo the cannon to sink the ship. The game ends when a player loses all his/her boats. Players gets points for sinking boats. Whoever has the most points wins.

boardgame.name: Immortal Tales
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

TALES OF IMMORTALS FROM AN IMMORTAL CREATOR...

Immortal Tales is a collection of sci-fi short stories from the sharp pen of writer/artist Steve Ditko (with a little help from his fellow comics industry legend and "Spider-Man" co-creator Stan Lee). The stories are thematically linked in that they all deal with the topic of immortality.

In addition to the great comics, the book includes sets of roleplaying game rules that were inspired by them. Although designed with the d20 System in mind, most the rule material is easily adapted to a variety of game systems. (The rules were designed by Steve Miller, known for his contributions to classic game-settings such as Dragonlance and Ravenloft.)

boardgame.name: Mortus vs. Mercy
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Double Team: Mortus VS Mercy provides two characters for your Mutants & Masterminds games: a villain, Mortus, and a hero, Mercy.

Mortus is a partially dead being who rules a pocket dimension where nothing but the undead remain. He seeks to wipe out all life everywhere with the help of his unliving armies.

Mercy is a talented surgeon who gained her powers from the shock of an "honor" acid attack. Her suit now helps her with the pain as she uses her newfound powers to heal and help others.

Each character is accompanied by three adventure ideas to make it easier to work them into your game.

boardgame.name: Shadowed Keep on the Borderlands (2.0 - PF1)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A 1st edition Pathfinder Roleplaying Game compatible adventure for 1st-level PCs by Creighton Broadhurst

Hidden deep in the borderland forest, bandits lurk in the ruined castle of a long-dead border lord. Their incessant raids draw a band of neophyte heroes to the derelict keep. There they discover fouler, more odious dangers lurk below the ruins.

Dare you brave the terrors of the Shadowed Keep to crush that which lurks within or will darkness shroud the surrounding lands?

Shadowed Keep on the Borderlands is an adventure for 1st-level characters compatible with the 5th edition of the world’s most popular roleplaying game. Designed for the Duchy of Ashlar campaign setting the adventure can be easily inserted into a GM's home campaign.

What's New?

A new, super easy to use layout
New maps by Tommi Salama
New art by Matt Morrow
Enhanced detail of the town of Dulwich
Enhanced details of the Shadowed Keeps environs

boardgame.name: Field of Blood
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A phone call leads the agents to investigate a set of seemingly random and unconnected murders. What the agents uncover traces back to one of the most infamous betrayals in history and the biggest question is will they survive the consequences of the experience.

boardgame.name: Whispers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

What do you get when you mix Nazis, archeologists, meteoric iron, and Tibet? The Archdeacons don't know, but someone is willing to kill for it, and it falls on the Secret Agents of CROSS to figure out who and why before whoever can answer the question gets to it first.

boardgame.name: Blackest Friday Ever
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

In the United States, the Thanksgiving season brings two of America’s favorite things into direct conflict, eating one’s self into a stupor and shopping one’s self into a frenzy. This Thanksgiving, however, is going to be unlike any other when the two merge into something far more sinister.

This product is a 4-page mission for Secret Agents of CROSS. Use as-is or expand to your liking.

boardgame.name: Blood Ties
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A missing person case is usually mundane and procedural, but when your mission is ordered from deep inside the Vatican and you are a Secret Agent of CROSS no case ever is. Join your teammates as you travel to Jolly Old England to locate a celebrated otolaryngologist that has gone missing. It's a cut-throat world out there so you better smell out his location before you hear of his untimely demise.

boardgame.name: From the Breath of Brahma
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

When does a New York neighborhood have bigger problems than juvenile delinquency or alligators in the sewers? When a mythical monster comes to town to sample the menu for all his hungry friends.

This product is a 6-page mission for Secret Agents of CROSS. Use as-is or expand to your liking.

boardgame.name: Road Less Traveled
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

For most people, a car is just a means to get from one place to another, for others, it is an expression of who they are. When that owner is also a sociopath your team is in grave danger.

This product is a 4-page mission for Secret Agents of CROSS. Use as-is or expand to your liking.

boardgame.name: Vididiots
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

The video game market is a 78 billion dollar industry and the competition to design the next monster franchise is cutthroat beyond most human comprehension. One of the most important elements of the gaming craze is the vast numbers of individuals these games can reach out and touch. These fascinating business facts are nonetheless usually far outside the area of concern for the average CROSS agent, but for once, this Halloween, it seems that the gaming industry’s business and the Vatican’s business are one and the same.

boardgame.name: The Cat and the Resurrection
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Mr. Mu was no ordinary cat; he was an extraordinary cat… In fact, you could say he was a genius-level cat. When Mr. Mu’s beloved owner, Mrs. Wynworth, was on her deathbed succumbing to old age, Mr. Mu came up with a plan. He summoned a mysterious woman, dressed entirely in black, to the Village of Greenleaf to resurrect his beloved Mrs. Wynworth when she passed. The Woman in Black performed a mysterious ritual at the death bed of his dying owner.

At Mrs. Wynworth’s funeral, the outcome of the ritual unfolded... Mrs. Wynworth’s coffin opened, her body levitated above the ground. In a state of excitement, Mr. Mu jumped on the pulpit and said, “Mrs. Wynworth, my best friend, I have brought you back from the dead! Oh, rise my beloved Mrs. Wynworth. Rise from the darkness and return to the world of the living.” However, Mr. Mu was deceived. He witnessed the levitating body burst into flame and ash. The ritual the Woman in Black performed at Mrs. Wynworth’s deathbed was not a resurrection ritual; instead, it was a ritual to trap the Village on Greenleaf in a pocket dimension.

A thick mist encircled the entire village and storm clouds hid the sky. The Village of Greenleaf was trapped. The Woman in Black rose and hovered in the air. She told the mourners her plan of entrapping the village and devouring their souls. The Woman in Black vanished in a cloud of smoke; she was weak from the ritual and would need to return to her lair to regain her full strength. When she returned, she would devour the villager’s souls.

There was a race against time... A portal would need to be opened to the Woman in Black’s lair. She would need to be defeated while still in a weakened state. Fortunately for the villagers, Murt, whose intelligence was enhanced by experiments performed by extraterrestrials, knew how to create such a portal. Murt worked tirelessly for five days and opened a portal to the Woman in Black’s lair. Now, it will be up to YOUR PLAYERS to transverse the interdimensional lair and defeat the Woman in Black before she regains her full strength.

The Cat and the Resurrection is a third-party compatible DCC adventure designed for a Level 2 party of 6 to 10 characters. This adventure builds on the events of Beneath The Giant's Head and Fantastic Adventures and the Disgruntled Gong Farmer.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Tomb of the Savage Kings
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Portnelle's most popular and wealthy socialite, the widow Zita Aztur, has approached the PCs in a desperate plea for assistance. Zita's sister Isobel has gone missing! Isobel had recently become smitten with a mysterious suitor who fancies himself an adventurer.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

listing.notes: FB

boardgame.name: The Starfinder Four vs. The Hardlight Harlequin
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Everyone across the galaxy enjoys the occasional diversion in a holographic amusement chamber, whether it's relaxing on a sandy beach or taking part in an action-packed adventure on a war-torn battlefield from the safety of home. But what happens when the digital settings and inhabitants of these simulations come to life and threaten a group of innocent fun seekers?

listing.notes: U
Buyer pays $6 shipping.

boardgame.name: Threshold of Knowledge
El Umbral del Conocimiento
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

The graduates of the Magaambya are known as some of the greatest wielders of magic in Golarion. now it's time for a new group of students to take their first steps on the path to greatness.

In The Threshold of Knowledge, players take on the role of one of five students from the prestigious Magaambya, the oldest school of magic in the Inner Sea region. When a teacher goes missing, it s up to these new heroes to step up and solve a wicked mystery that threatens the existence of the Magaambya itself!

Threshold of Knowledge is a short adventure for 1st-level characters that takes the heroes into the Magaambya and the nearby city of Nantambu. In addition, the five pre-generated characters provide a quick way to jump into the adventure right away in this exciting offering for Free RPG Day! Grab some dice and some friends and play the role of new heroes in training!

listing.notes:
The graduates of the Magaambya are known as some of the greatest wielders of magic in Golarion. now it's time for a new group of students to take their first steps on the path to greatness.
In The Threshold of Knowledge, players take on the role of one of five students from the prestigious Magaambya, the oldest school of magic in the Inner Sea region. When a teacher goes missing, it s up to these new heroes to step up and solve a wicked mystery that threatens the existence of the Magaambya itself!
Threshold of Knowledge is a short adventure for 1st-level characters that takes the heroes into the Magaambya and the nearby city of Nantambu.
